original: de ltar yang gang bshad pa mi bslu ba ni don ji lta ba rtogs pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang gang bshad pa mi bslu ba ni don ji lta ba rtogs pa yin pa ste /

original: de ni don gyi chos so //
analyzed: de ni don gyi chos so //
translated: That is the object dharma.

original: shes pa ni de ltar rig pa ste de ni shes pa'i chos so //
analyzed: shes pa ni de ltar rig pa ste de ni shes pa'i chos so //
translated: Knowledge is the awareness of that, and that is the knowledge dharma.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni don ji lta ba yin pa dang / de rig pa dag med pa'i phyir don byed par rtogs pa'i mi bslu ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni don ji lta ba yin pa dang / de rig pa dag med pa'i phyir don byed par rtogs pa'i mi bslu ba med pa yin te /

original: de ni don byed gnas pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni don byed gnas pa zhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
translated: That is taught by the words ‚Äúthe establishment of the object‚Äôs function.‚Äù

original: don byed par gnas pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don byed par gnas pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The establishment of the object‚Äôs function is the realization.

original: de ni mi rigs te sngar mthong ba'i me ni phrad par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te sngar mthong ba'i me ni phrad par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /

analyzed: de don du gnyer ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro // sreg pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Because it is not sought for its own sake.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúIt is sought for the sake of burning and so on,‚Äù

original: de ltar na sreg pa la sogs pa 'grub pa nyid phrad par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na sreg pa la sogs pa 'grub pa nyid phrad par bya ba yin la /
translated: in that case, the establishment of burning and so on is what is to be contacted.

original: de yang mngon sum gyis sngar shes zin pa'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni mi bslu ba la bye brag med do //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyis sngar shes zin pa'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni mi bslu ba la bye brag med do //

original: gnas pa rtogs ba ni sgra'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa rtogs ba ni sgra'i don ma yin te /

original: 'dug pa'i nag pa ni 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dug pa'i nag pa ni 'gro ba ma yin no //

original: 'dir yang 'dug pa dang / rnam par gnas pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad yongs su dor nas /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'dug pa dang / rnam par gnas pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad yongs su dor nas /

analyzed: don gzhan yongs su bstan pa la yang dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang / mi nus pa'i phyir dang / rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir mi rigs pa nyid kyis bkag pa'i phyir yang ngo //

original: grags pa'i don blangs pa yin na /
analyzed: grags pa'i don blangs pa yin na /
translated: If one accepts the meaning that is well known,

original: dgos pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa yin par bstan pa yin no //

original: mi bslu ba can nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin nam /üîΩde yang rtogs pa po'i mngon sum dang rjes su @39a * //
analyzed: mi bslu ba can nyid tshad ma nyid ma yin nam / de yang rtogs pa po'i mngon sum dang rjes su @39a * //
translated: Isn‚Äôt being nondeceptive itself valid knowledge?üîΩThat also exists for the direct perception and inference of the person who understands.

original: dpag pa la yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpag pa la yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: de yod pa ni yul mtshungs pa can gyi thabs gzhan la gus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa ni yul mtshungs pa can gyi thabs gzhan la gus pa ma yin no //

original: bcom ldan 'das ni gzhan gyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni gzhan gyi mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: The Lord is not the direct perception or inference of others,

original: de dang ldan pa yin par ni //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yin par ni //
translated: but he is endowed with them.

original: de ldan bcom ldan tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: de ldan bcom ldan tshad ma nyid //
translated: He is the valid cognition of the Lord,

original: ces 'chad par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ces 'chad par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: as will be explained.üîΩSince the principal one exists, no one seeks the nominal.

original: gtso bo yod bzhin du nye bar btags pa don du gnyer ba ni su yang med pa'i phyir gus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo yod bzhin du nye bar btags pa don du gnyer ba ni su yang med pa'i phyir gus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not devoted.

original: de yang / 'on kyang gnas skabs kyis cung zad //
analyzed: de yang / 'on kyang gnas skabs kyis cung zad //
translated: Moreover, he is a little bit

original: til mar 'bras can mar sogs bzhin //
analyzed: til mar 'bras can mar sogs bzhin //
translated: like sesame oil, rice, butter, and so on.

original: gang de kun gyis kun mkhyen pa //üîΩyid du zad mod mi 'gag go //
analyzed: gang de kun gyis kun mkhyen pa // yid du zad mod mi 'gag go //
translated: Whatever is known by all

original: zhes smos so //üîΩ'on te 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la ni /
analyzed: zhes smos so // 'on te 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul ma yin pa 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa la ni /

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa yin na de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dod pa yin na de yang ma yin te /
translated: If the Lord asserts the existence of other worlds, which are not the objects of direct perception and so on of us and so on, that also is not so.

original: de la yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i ngo bo yul ma yin pa nyid kyis 'jug pa med pa'i phyir dang / dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i ngo bo yul ma yin pa nyid kyis 'jug pa med pa'i phyir dang / dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //

original: rtogs pa po la ltos nas kyang btags pa pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa po la ltos nas kyang btags pa pa yin pa'i phyir /

original: mi 'jug pas de yongs su brtags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jug pas de yongs su brtags pa ma yin no //

original: sna tshogs pa can gyi 'jig rten las kyang 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa can gyi 'jig rten las kyang 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa ni ji skad du /

analyzed: las las skyes pa'i 'jig rten ni sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe world is a variety that arises from karma.‚Äù

original: rgyu tsam la rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu tsam la rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
translated: Inference is with regard to the mere cause,üîΩbut the specific is the Bhagavat.

original: bye brag tu ni bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dbye ba yin no zhes gang smras pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu ni bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bya ba ni yul gyi dbye ba yin no zhes gang smras pa ni ma yin te /

original: de la de lta bu'i shes pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir dang por rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la de lta bu'i shes pa la rgyu med pa'i phyir dang por rjes su dpag pa ma yin te /

original: de ni spyi'i spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni spyi'i spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'on te mi bslu ba can nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te mi bslu ba can nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: But the nondeceptive nature belongs only to the Bhagavat,

original: mngon sum gyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi ni ma yin te /

analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam las nges pa'i phyir dang / rjes su dpag pa'i yang ma yin te /

original: de las byung ba nyid kyis khyab pa ma grub ba'i phyir ro //üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba nyid kyis khyab pa ma grub ba'i phyir ro // ma yin te /
translated: because it is not established that it arises from that.üîΩNo, because it follows that there would be no proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par yang de'i shes pa bskyed pa 'am /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par yang de'i shes pa bskyed pa 'am /
translated: The cognition of that is produced either by direct perception or inference,

original: go bar byed pa yang rung ba sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: go bar byed pa yang rung ba sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: or it is a proof that causes understanding.

original: de dag med na de grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rang nyid med pa yin @39b no ;
analyzed: de dag med na de grub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rang nyid med pa yin @39b no ;
translated: Since it would not be established if those did not exist, it would not exist by itself.

original: / mngon sum la sogs pa yang tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: / mngon sum la sogs pa yang tshad ma yin la /
translated: Direct perception and so on are valid knowledge,

original: de nyid mi bslu ba dang 'bral ba yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyis chog gi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid mi bslu ba dang 'bral ba yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyis chog gi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: and since they are nondeceptive, that alone is sufficient, not anything else.

original: de nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir 'u bu cag gis mi bslu ba'i yul de la ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir 'u bu cag gis mi bslu ba'i yul de la ma yin te /

original: yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not an object at all.üîΩAll of that is merely imputed.

original: de lta bu thams cad ni btags pa ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu thams cad ni btags pa ba kho na yin te /
translated: And that is stated:

original: de yang / nyung du shes pa'ang kun shes par //
analyzed: de yang / nyung du shes pa'ang kun shes par //
translated: Even knowing a little is said to be all-knowing,

original: phal pa la 'jug ces brjod pa //üîΩzhes smos pa ste /
analyzed: phal pa la 'jug ces brjod pa // zhes smos pa ste /
translated: Engaging in the ordinary.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: That is explained:

original: bcom ldan 'das tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde nyid ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba'o // de nyid ni /
translated: The Blessed One is a valid cognizer.üîΩIsn't it also explained that

original: de ldan bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid ces kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ldan bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid ces kyang 'chad par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: he possesses that, the Blessed One is a valid cognizer?

original: der yang mngon sum la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan yul mtshungs pa nyid yin par dogs pa la de bzhin du /
analyzed: der yang mngon sum la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan yul mtshungs pa nyid yin par dogs pa la de bzhin du /
translated: There too, regarding the doubt that direct perception and so onüîΩand the Blessed One have the same object, it would be established as different by the division of objects, saying,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshad ma yin gyi de nyid ni ma yin zhes yul gyi dbye bas tha dad par sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //

original: 'on te 'di la mngon sum la sogs pa mi bslu ba can la sogs pa nyid kho na bde bar gshegs pa'i phyir de nyid kho na tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te 'di la mngon sum la sogs pa mi bslu ba can la sogs pa nyid kho na bde bar gshegs pa'i phyir de nyid kho na tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Or, is it that the Blessed One is the valid cognition because he is non-deceptive with regard to direct perception and so on, and only he is the valid cognition,

original: gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin te /

analyzed: mi bslu ba mi shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //

original: de ltar dogs pa de la yang mngon sum la sogs pa bzhin du rnyed par sla ba mi bslu ba can gyi shes pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das nyid dam /üîΩkhyad par byed pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa can nyid kyis mi bslu ba can nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kho na yin pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar dogs pa de la yang mngon sum la sogs pa bzhin du rnyed par sla ba mi bslu ba can gyi shes pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das nyid dam / khyad par byed pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa can nyid kyis mi bslu ba can nyid ni bcom ldan 'das kho na yin pa'am /
translated: In response to such doubts, the Blessed One himself is non-deceptive, like direct perception and so on,

original: gzhan gyis de sgrub par byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid dang / ji ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de sgrub par byed pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid dang / ji ltar yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: or he is non-deceptive by being associated with a cognition that produces a special quality, or he is non-deceptive by being in accordance with what establishes that, as will be explained.

original: de dang ldan pa ni mi bslu ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni mi bslu ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Blessed One himself who possesses that is the valid cognition that possesses non-deceptiveness and so on. This is the meaning.

original: 'on te mngon sum la sogs pa ni mi bslu ba shes pa yin pa'i phyir rigs nas bcom ldan 'das ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum la sogs pa ni mi bslu ba shes pa yin pa'i phyir rigs nas bcom ldan 'das ni ma yin te /

analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir la /

analyzed: tshad ma ni rtogs pa yin no snyam du dogs pa la de dang ldan pa ste /

analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa dang ldan pa de'i bdag nyid kyis te /
translated: that is, he possesses direct perception and so on, and by that nature,

analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad ma yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: therefore the Bhagavat himself is valid cognition.

original: der yang mngon sum la sogs pa nyid tshad ma'i gtso bo yin te rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der yang mngon sum la sogs pa nyid tshad ma'i gtso bo yin te rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there, direct perception and so on are the principal valid cognitions because they have the nature of realization.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni @40a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni @40a * //
translated: The Bhagavat is not a valid cognition because he is not a valid cognition that is a consciousness.

analyzed: tshad ma dang 'dra bas tshad mar gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bsam pas dogs pa la /
translated: To dispel that doubt, it is said that he is a valid cognition because he is similar to a valid cognition.

original: khyab par byed pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kho na tshad ma'i gtso bo yin la /

analyzed: gzhan ni de dang mthun pa nyid kyi gtso bo ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The other is not the principal one, because it is similar to that.

original: gal te de'i yul tha dad pa ma yin pas tshad ma nyid ma yin no snyam pas yul gyi dbye ba las tshad ma nyid yin pa ni 'dir don yin no zhes zer ba de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de'i yul tha dad pa ma yin pas tshad ma nyid ma yin no snyam pas yul gyi dbye ba las tshad ma nyid yin pa ni 'dir don yin no zhes zer ba de lta na /
translated: If one says that it is a valid cognition because it is a classification of the object, but not because its object is not different, then

analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa bzhin du yul gyi dbye bas tshad ma tha dad pa yin na tshad ma ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba nyams par 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa la de ldan zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: if it is a valid cognition that is different due to being a classification of the object, like direct perception and so on, then the statement ‚ÄúValid cognition is of two types‚Äù would be undermined. Fearing this, the opponent says, ‚ÄúIt possesses that.‚Äù

original: gal te yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba nyid kyis yul tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang mthong ba dang ma mthong ba nyid kyis yul tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If seeing and not seeing are different objects,

original: de lta na yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang de bzhin te /
translated: then it is just like that.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa kho na bzhin du mi bslu bas bcom ldan 'das kyang bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i don 'o na ni mi bslu ba can nyid ni bcom ldan 'das nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa kho na bzhin du mi bslu bas bcom ldan 'das kyang bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i don 'o na ni mi bslu ba can nyid ni bcom ldan 'das nyid yin gyi /
translated: If it is nondeceptive like direct perception and so on, then the BhagavƒÅn is also nondeceptive in the same way, without distinction.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir don yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir don yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is not something else.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa med na de lta na de kho na nyid du bcom ldan 'das ci nas kyang mi 'grub bo snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa med na de lta na de kho na nyid du bcom ldan 'das ci nas kyang mi 'grub bo snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: If direct perception and so on do not exist, then how could the BhagavƒÅn be established as reality?

original: mngon sum la sogs pa sgrub par byed par gyur bas de dang ldan pa'i bsgrub byar gyur pa yang bcom ldan 'das ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa sgrub par byed par gyur bas de dang ldan pa'i bsgrub byar gyur pa yang bcom ldan 'das ma yin la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is not established as something that possesses that which is to be established by direct perception and so on, nor is he established as something that is devoid of that.

original: de dang bral bas kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang bral bas kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement ‚Äúhe is not that.‚Äù

original: gal te yang mngon sum ni mi bslu ba la sogs pas tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das nyid khyab par byed pa de nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad mi rigs te /

translated: If direct perception and so on are not valid cognitions because they are deceptive and so on, then in the same way the BhagavƒÅn is not valid because he is pervaded by that.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mi bslu ba'i shes pa tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir mi bslu ba'i shes pa tshad ma yin te /
translated: A nondeceptive consciousness is a valid cognition because it is the nature of consciousness.

original: blo ni tshad ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
analyzed: blo ni tshad ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
translated: This is because of the statement ‚Äúthe mind is valid cognition.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das ni yul rtogs pa'i shes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni yul rtogs pa'i shes pa ma yin la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is not a consciousness that realizes an object.

original: der zhen pa'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: der zhen pa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that it is not attached to that,

original: de kho na nyid mi shes pa tsam gyi yang dbang med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa la de dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mi shes pa tsam gyi yang dbang med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa la de dang ldan pa ste /
translated: because it is powerless, merely not knowing reality.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tshad ma ni bcom ldan 'das yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i tshad ma ni bcom ldan 'das yin te /
translated: The Bhagavat is the valid cognition that possesses that,üîΩbecause the Bhagavat possesses direct perception, etc.,

original: ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das la mnga' ba yin te /üîΩde'i bdag nyid kyis zhes 'chad bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das la mnga' ba yin te / de'i bdag nyid kyis zhes 'chad bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: which have the characteristics as they have been taught.

original: gtso bo @40b dang gtso bo ma yin pa nyid dang / khyab par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gtso bo @40b dang gtso bo ma yin pa nyid dang / khyab par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa yin la /
translated: He is the principal one and not the principal one, and he is not the pervader.

original: 'dir ni shes pa dang mi shes pa nyid kyi bye brag la the tshom za ba la bye brag med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni shes pa dang mi shes pa nyid kyi bye brag la the tshom za ba la bye brag med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: But here, there is no distinction in the doubt about the difference between knowing and not knowing.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mthong ba'i yul la tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mthong ba'i yul la tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The Bhagavat is not a valid cognition with respect to the object of seeing,üîΩbecause he is not a valid cognition with respect to the object of seeing.

original: gang gis de'i yul rtogs pa'i mngon sum la sogs pas rtogs pa'i don la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de'i yul rtogs pa'i mngon sum la sogs pas rtogs pa'i don la ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the object is known by the perception of the person who knows the object.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i tshad ma yul ma yin pas mi mthong ba 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas lan du de ni med de /
analyzed: 'u bu cag la sogs pa'i tshad ma yul ma yin pas mi mthong ba 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas lan du de ni med de /
translated: The reply is that it is not the case that the other world and so on are not seen because they are not objects of valid cognition for us and so on.

original: rang dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: rang dngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The meaning is that they are not objects of the valid cognitions of us and so on.

original: / rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: / rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt inference also not a cognition that apprehends its object by the power of the object?

original: yin pa de ltar na mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yin pa de ltar na mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, it would follow that it is perception.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol la yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol la yin no //
translated: But it is external.

original: des na de nyid 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'i yul can yang yin no //üîΩ'byung rngub dbang po'i shes rnams kyis //
analyzed: des na de nyid 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa'i yul can yang yin no // 'byung rngub dbang po'i shes rnams kyis //
translated: Therefore, it is also the subject of the other world and so on.üîΩThe inhalation and exhalation are not the body alone,

original: skyes pa lus 'ba' zhig las min //
analyzed: skyes pa lus 'ba' zhig las min //
translated: because they are the objects of the sense consciousnesses.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This will be explained.

original: 'di la rjes su dpag pa ni zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la rjes su dpag pa ni zhes smos pa'o //
translated: Here, inference is mentioned.

original: dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa rnams goms pa las byung ba'i bye brag nyid yin te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa la sogs pa rnams goms pa las byung ba'i bye brag nyid yin te /
translated: It is a specific case arising from the habituation of inhaling and so on.

original: goms pas sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: goms pas sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it seen that habituation precedes it?

original: skye ba la sogs pa la yang rang gi rigs kyis goms pa go bar byad pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas go par byed pa yod pa yin no snyam sems pa la /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa la yang rang gi rigs kyis goms pa go bar byad pa yin pa'i phyir 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas go par byed pa yod pa yin no snyam sems pa la /
translated: Also, in the case of arising and so on, it is understood through habituation to its type. Therefore it is understood through apprehending a relation.

original: khyab pa can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: khyab pa can gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa zhes smos te /
translated: The response to this is ‚Äúapprehending a relation that is pervasive.‚Äù

original: khyab pa can gyi 'brel pa ni khyab bya khyab byed kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: khyab pa can gyi 'brel pa ni khyab bya khyab byed kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: A relation that is pervasive is the nature of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa las log pa yin na 'dzin pa yin grang na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus pa las log pa yin na 'dzin pa yin grang na /
translated: If it is apprehended, it is the opposite of all discordant classes.

original: tshu rol mthong ba pas ni de ltar mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba pas ni de ltar mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: But those who see only what is near do not see it in that way.

original: mthong ba ni rang gi ngo bo mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ni rang gi ngo bo mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because seeing is limited to its own nature.

original: lhan cig pa nyid du yang dang yang du mthong ba las nges pa'i shes pa yin na ni skyon 'di yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig pa nyid du yang dang yang du mthong ba las nges pa'i shes pa yin na ni skyon 'di yin te /
translated: If it is a definite knowledge from seeing again and again that it is simultaneous, then this is the error.

original: lan cig min par ltan cig pa nyid du mthong ba rnams kyi yang 'khrul par mthong bas don gyis go ba mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan cig min par ltan cig pa nyid du mthong ba rnams kyi yang 'khrul par mthong bas don gyis go ba mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning is not understood, since it is seen that even those who see the effect and the reason simultaneously or not simultaneously see them as mistaken.

original: 'bras bu nyid ni lan cig kyang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis mthong na 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa'i skyon med do snyam du sems pa la /üîΩba snyad tsam du tshad ma @41a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni lan cig kyang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag gis mthong na 'brel pa mi 'dzin pa'i skyon med do snyam du sems pa la / ba snyad tsam du tshad ma @41a * //
translated: If the effect is seen by perception and non-apprehension even once, then the fault of not apprehending the relation does not occur.

original: yin gyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: yin gyi zhes smos so //
translated: Thinking this, he says, ‚ÄúValidity is merely conventional.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'i dpe'i don du ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'i dpe'i don du ste /
translated: The meaning of the example is that perception apprehends.

original: dper na mngon sum ni rang gi ngo bo'i yul can yin yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can du tha snyad kyis nges pa yin la /
analyzed: dper na mngon sum ni rang gi ngo bo'i yul can yin yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i yul can du tha snyad kyis nges pa yin la /
translated: For example, although perception has an object that is its own nature, it is ascertained conventionally as having an object that will arise.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum du mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi nges pa las 'bras bu nyid dang 'brel pa grub pa la brten pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum du mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi nges pa las 'bras bu nyid dang 'brel pa grub pa la brten pa yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, inference is based on the relation of effect to reason that is established from ascertainment preceded by non-apprehension of the effect by perception.

original: de bzhin du don dam pa pa dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam pa pa dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like that in the case of the relation to the ultimate.

original: de lta bu'i rjes su dpag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa la 'gal ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rjes su dpag pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa grub pa la 'gal ba can ma yin te /
translated: Such an inference is not contradictory to the establishment of omniscience,

original: de 'grub pa'i bsgoms pas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'grub pa'i bsgoms pas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by the cultivation that accomplishes that.

original: yang na 'bras bu dang rgyu las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa de nyid las de rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu dang rgyu las byung ba'i rjes su dpag pa de nyid las de rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Or, it is taught that omniscience is understood from that very inference that arises from effect and cause.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúomniscience.‚Äù

original: bstan bcos ni 'bras bu'i yul can ma yin nam /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni 'bras bu'i yul can ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the treatise about the effect?

original: 'bras bu mtho ris dang 'brel pa'i yul can yang yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu mtho ris dang 'brel pa'i yul can yang yin gyi /
translated: It is also about the effect that is related to the higher realms.

original: rang gi yul dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi yul dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not depend on grasping its own object,

original: 'jig rten la grags pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa tsam la ltos pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pas phyi'i don rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa tsam la ltos pa dang / 'dod pa la sogs pas phyi'i don rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends merely on the connection with things that are known in the world, and because it makes known external objects through desire and so on.

original: tshad ma ni the tshom med pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang / skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid du nges pas rgyu'i skyon med par nges pa la phyin ci log tu dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni the tshom med pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang / skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa nyid du nges pas rgyu'i skyon med par nges pa la phyin ci log tu dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a valid cognition generates a consciousness that is free from doubt, and because there is no doubt that the cause is free from error, since it is ascertained that it is not produced by a person.

original: mngon par 'dod pa dang phrad par byed pa nyid kyis phyir mi bslu ba can yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa dang phrad par byed pa nyid kyis phyir mi bslu ba can yin gyi /
translated: It is nondeceptive because it causes one to attain the desired object.

original: de'i yul la bcom ldan 'das tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i yul la bcom ldan 'das tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is not a valid cognition with regard to that object.

original: des rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa la zhes zer ba ni /üîΩgal te rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' yang mdor bsdus pa ni sgra la ni du ba bzhin du don dang lhan cig pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'brel pa med pa'i phyir smra ba po'i rgyud kyi shes pa'i yul gyi don brdar byas pa can la /
analyzed: des rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa la zhes zer ba ni / gal te rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // grub pa'i mtha' yang mdor bsdus pa ni sgra la ni du ba bzhin du don dang lhan cig pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'brel pa med pa'i phyir smra ba po'i rgyud kyi shes pa'i yul gyi don brdar byas pa can la /
translated: It is taught that ‚Äúhe is one who realizes it.‚ÄùüîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that the BhagavƒÅn is a valid cognition with regard to the meaning of the scriptures,‚Äù then it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the BhagavƒÅn is not a valid cognition with regard to the meaning of the scriptures, then it is not tenable that he is a teacher of the scriptures.‚Äù

original: sgra las nyan pa pos rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra las nyan pa pos rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The tenets are summarized as follows: Because there is no relationship that is the nature of sound that is simultaneous with the object, as is the case with smoke, the object that is the object of the consciousness in the continuum of the speaker, which is designated as the sign, is understood by the listener from the sound.

original: de'i tshe sgra ni brtags so //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgra ni brtags so //
translated: The sound is the reason.

original: don de rtogs pa can gyi smra ba po ni chos can no //
analyzed: don de rtogs pa can gyi smra ba po ni chos can no //
translated: The speaker who understands the meaning is the subject.

original: rtogs pa'i yul gyi don ni bsgrub bya yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i yul gyi don ni bsgrub bya yin no //
translated: The meaning that is the object of understanding is the probandum.

original: rtogs bzhin pa'i me bzhin du don de nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs bzhin pa nyid ma yin pa la ji ltar rtogs kyang rung don med pa yin na ni sgra las @41b byung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa'i me bzhin du don de nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs bzhin pa nyid ma yin pa la ji ltar rtogs kyang rung don med pa yin na ni sgra las @41b byung ba yang ngo //
translated: If the meaning is not present while it is being understood, like a fire that is being understood, then it would be meaningless to understand it, even though the sound is present.

original: yid ches pas bstan pa yin na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin la /
analyzed: yid ches pas bstan pa yin na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yin la /
translated: If it is taught with confidence, it is inference for the sake of others.

original: smra ba po'i bsam pa la 'bras bu las byung ba'i yang dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po'i bsam pa la 'bras bu las byung ba'i yang dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: If it arises from the result of the speaker's intention, it is correct inference.

original: de ni 'dir skabs ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dir skabs ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the point here.

original: don de yul bsam bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don de yul bsam bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning is the object of thought.

original: rtags kyang du ba las me rjes su dpog pa bzhin du phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa'i nges pa med kyang /
analyzed: rtags kyang du ba las me rjes su dpog pa bzhin du phyogs kyi chos nyid la sogs pa'i nges pa med kyang /
translated: And the reason, like inferring fire from smoke, is not certain in the property of the subject and so on.

original: gang las go bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: gang las go bar byed pa yin /
translated: From what is it understood?

original: de la yang res 'ga' zhig du ba bzhin du de'i chos nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa yod par rtogs pa'i don du blo la grub pa dang 'brel pa can gyi sgra las byung ba yang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de la yang res 'ga' zhig du ba bzhin du de'i chos nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa yod par rtogs pa'i don du blo la grub pa dang 'brel pa can gyi sgra las byung ba yang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni //
translated: And sometimes, like smoke, it is inference that arises from a word that is related to what is established in the mind for the purpose of realizing the existence of its reality and so on.

original: smra ba po'i bya ba'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: smra ba po'i bya ba'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by the object of the speaker's action and so on.

original: blo'i don yul nyid ni ji ltar thos pa don gyi de kho na nyid de don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan dang 'brel pa gang yin pa gang gi yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo'i don yul nyid ni ji ltar thos pa don gyi de kho na nyid de don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan dang 'brel pa gang yin pa gang gi yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word is the object of the mind, and the ultimate reason that is the reality of the object as it is heard is related to that. That which has that is called inference.

original: blo la grub pa dang 'brel pa can nyid ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: blo la grub pa dang 'brel pa can nyid ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that it is related to what is established in the mind.

original: rgyas par ni sgra las byung ba rnam par bcad pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyas par ni sgra las byung ba rnam par bcad pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: In detail, it depends on the exclusion that arises from words.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i bya ba log pa yin na smra ba po'i don dang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa smra ba po'i blo la gnas pa'i don rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa ni 'jigs pa'i ma yin pa 'gegs pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i bya ba log pa yin na smra ba po'i don dang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa smra ba po'i blo la gnas pa'i don rjes su dpag pa las rtogs pa ni 'jigs pa'i ma yin pa 'gegs pa bstan pa ni /
translated: If the function of verbal expression is reversed, then the meaning that is the same as the speaker's meaning, which is the meaning that abides in the speaker's mind, is understood from inference. The negation of what is to be feared is taught.

original: smra ba po'i byed pa ni brjod par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba po'i byed pa ni brjod par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The speaker's function is the desire to express.

original: nyan pa po ni smra ba po'i bsam pa la brjod pa'i don ji lta ba go bar byed la /
analyzed: nyan pa po ni smra ba po'i bsam pa la brjod pa'i don ji lta ba go bar byed la /
translated: The listener understands the expressed meaning just as it is in the speaker's intention.

original: de bzhin du smra ba po yang nyan pa po'i blo la gnas par bya ba'i phyir smra bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du smra ba po yang nyan pa po'i blo la gnas par bya ba'i phyir smra bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Similarly, the speaker speaks in order to make the object of expression abide in the listener's mind. This is the meaning.

original: sgra ni mngon par brjod pa nyid kyi bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin la /
analyzed: sgra ni mngon par brjod pa nyid kyi bya ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin la /
translated: Sound is the function of verbal expression, not anything else.

original: de lta yin na de'i rjes su dpag pa tshad ma gzhan nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta yin na de'i rjes su dpag pa tshad ma gzhan nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: If that were the case, its inference would be a different valid cognition.

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni de rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni de rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: In our position, that is taught to be an inference.

original: sgra'i byed pa ni de nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i byed pa ni de nyid la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The function of the word is that very thing.

original: gal te smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa'i yul gyi bstan bcos thams cad tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te smra ba po'i brjod par 'dod pa'i yul gyi bstan bcos thams cad tshad ma yin na /
translated: If the entire treatise of the object of expression of the speaker is valid cognition,

original: de las gcig kyang 'jug par byed pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de las gcig kyang 'jug par byed pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid yin gyi /
translated: then even one of them is valid cognition by the very fact of engagement.

original: thams cad ni thams cad kyis nan tan du bya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: thams cad ni thams cad kyis nan tan du bya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: But if all of them were not to be taken seriously,

original: 'di dag thams cad thams cad kyi yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad thams cad kyi yin pa kho na ste /
translated: then all of them would be all of them,

original: bye brag gi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag gi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for distinction.

original: @42a * // gal te bstan bcos rnams kyi phan tshun 'gal ba'i don nyid kyis don dam pa pa'i 'jig rten pha rol gyi yul nyid ma yin pa de lta na gang zhig yul yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: @42a * // gal te bstan bcos rnams kyi phan tshun 'gal ba'i don nyid kyis don dam pa pa'i 'jig rten pha rol gyi yul nyid ma yin pa de lta na gang zhig yul yin snyam pa la /
translated: If the very fact of mutual contradiction of the treatises is not the ultimate object of the world beyond, then what is the object?

original: de phyir gal te smra ba po //
analyzed: de phyir gal te smra ba po //
translated: Therefore, if the speaker

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: thams cad rig pa can gyi bka' las kyang de bzhin ni min nam /
analyzed: thams cad rig pa can gyi bka' las kyang de bzhin ni min nam /
translated: Isn't it the same in the statements of the omniscient one?

original: des na gal te smra ba po thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin nam gang phul du byung ba yin /
analyzed: des na gal te smra ba po thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin nam gang phul du byung ba yin /
translated: Therefore, if the speaker is not omniscient, or if he is not the best,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' ni don gyi de kho na nyid kyi yul can nyid yin pas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' ni don gyi de kho na nyid kyi yul can nyid yin pas gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid yin la /
translated: the words of the omniscient one are not the means of knowing reality, because they are mere inference for the sake of others,

original: gzhan gyi ni rjes su dpag pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni rjes su dpag pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //

analyzed: skyes bus byas pa la ni skyon yod par dogs pas 'jug par mi byed pa nyid ma yin nam /

original: skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa la ji ltar yin /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa la ji ltar yin /

original: sgra ni shin tu dri mi zhim pa can bzhin du rang bzhin gyis skyon dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni shin tu dri mi zhim pa can bzhin du rang bzhin gyis skyon dang ldan pa ma yin no //

analyzed: sgra'i don dang ma reg pa nyid kyang skyes bu'i skyon kho na yin no //

analyzed: skyon dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni bsam pa'i skyon gyis gzhan du gnas pa'i don la gzhan du rab tu sbyor ba yin te /

original: rtsva mchog gi rtse mo la glad po che brgya lta bu yin te /
analyzed: rtsva mchog gi rtse mo la glad po che brgya lta bu yin te /
translated: The tip of the ku≈õa grass is like the top of the head.

original: de lta bu'i tshig ni yid ches pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshig ni yid ches pa ma yin no //

original: de yang tshig gcig gis dgag pa la rab tu sbyor na yid ches pa mi 'dor pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshig gcig gis dgag pa la rab tu sbyor na yid ches pa mi 'dor pa yin no //
translated: If one applies the negation to the single word, then one does not abandon credibility.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: chu bo'i dogs na 'bras bu rnams //üîΩzhes bya ba yang yid ches pa rab tu sbyor ba yin na bden pa yin la /
analyzed: chu bo'i dogs na 'bras bu rnams // zhes bya ba yang yid ches pa rab tu sbyor ba yin na bden pa yin la /
translated: the fruits on the riverbanküîΩare credible when one applies them, but they are false

original: de nyid yid ches pa ma yin pas rab tu sbyor ba yin na brdzun par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid yid ches pa ma yin pas rab tu sbyor ba yin na brdzun par yang 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis skyon can yin na dus thams cad nyid du brdzun par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su rgan po rnams tha snyad du byed pa la /

analyzed: drung na gnas pa dag sgra 'di'i don yin zhes shes pa yin gyi /

original: sngon nas don de yin par shes pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon nas don de yin par shes pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They have the knowledge that this is the meaning from before.

original: des na dran par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: des na dran par mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, it is not remembered.

original: / sgra de yang /
analyzed: / sgra de yang /
translated: And that sound

original: don la sgra gzhan nye bar gyur ba'am ring yang rung /
analyzed: don la sgra gzhan nye bar gyur ba'am ring yang rung /

original: 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis smras pa ni don gzhan dang 'brel pa can du rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis smras pa ni don gzhan dang 'brel pa can du rjod par byed pa yin te /

analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar na tshig rnams ni don gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi don nyid du rang bzhin @42b gyis grub pa yin pa la skyes bu'i skyon gyis gzhan du byed pa'i phyir sgra'i skyon ma yin no //
translated: Thus, words are naturally established as having a meaning that is related to another object. But because of the fault of the person, they are used in another way. Therefore, the fault is not in the sound.

original: rig byed la ni skyes bu med pa'i phyir gzhan du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'jug par mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: rig byed la ni skyes bu med pa'i phyir gzhan du bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'jug par mi byed pa yin /

analyzed: de yang yang na gang zhig ces smra ba rang 'dod pa nyid du brjod pa ste /

original: des na skul byed skyon med pa //
analyzed: des na skul byed skyon med pa //

original: brdzun pa nyid du 'gal ba yin snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: brdzun pa nyid du 'gal ba yin snyam du sems pa la /

analyzed: ji lta de ltar yin du zin kyang skul byed kyi blo ni thams cad du rang gi so sor snang ba nyid kyi don la tshad ma yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though this is so, the mind that instigates is a valid cognition in regard to the meaning that appears to itself in every case, but not in regard to anything else.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni don gyi de nyid rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la ni don gyi de nyid rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In inference for the sake of another, the nature of the meaning is related by nature.

original: tshig ni rang nyid 'brel pa can ma yin yang 'brel pa can mtshon par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig ni rang nyid 'brel pa can ma yin yang 'brel pa can mtshon par byed pa yin te /
translated: Even though the words themselves are not related, they indicate the related.üîΩAs it is said:

original: gtan tshigs kyi tshig rang nyid ni //üîΩnus med yin yang nus mtshon byed //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi tshig rang nyid ni // nus med yin yang nus mtshon byed //
translated: Even though the words of the reason

original: ces smos so //
analyzed: ces smos so //
translated: are powerless, they indicate the powerful.

original: brjod bya'i bye brag rtogs pa ni rjod byed rang nyid dang 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan du na mi 'thad pa las zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa ste /
analyzed: brjod bya'i bye brag rtogs pa ni rjod byed rang nyid dang 'brel pa yin gyi gzhan du na mi 'thad pa las zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa ste /
translated: The understanding of the specific expressed is related to the expresser itself, but it is not tenable in any other way.üîΩAs it is said:

analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du bye brag rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no understanding of the specific, as there is with direct perception.

original: gzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i tha snyad las rjod byed kyi shes pa mtshon par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i tha snyad las rjod byed kyi shes pa mtshon par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The conventional knowledge of the realization of the benefit of others is indicated by the expression of the knowledge that expresses it.

original: gzhan gyi yang de'i shes pa ci las yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang de'i shes pa ci las yin /
translated: What is the knowledge of the other?

original: gzhan las so //
analyzed: gzhan las so //
translated: From another.

analyzed: de'i yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir long ba gcig la gcig lta bu nyid do //
translated: And the other of that is like one blind person seeing another.

original: yi ge la tha dad pa can gyi sgra'i shes pa bzhin du mthong ba med na /
analyzed: yi ge la tha dad pa can gyi sgra'i shes pa bzhin du mthong ba med na /
translated: If there is no seeing like the knowledge of a sound that has a different letter,

original: snang ba dang 'brel pa de bcos pa yin pa'i don ni sgra las byung ba rnam par bcad pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang 'brel pa de bcos pa yin pa'i don ni sgra las byung ba rnam par bcad pa bstan pa yin no //

original: mdor bsdus pa bstan nas /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the concise meaning,

analyzed: 'di'i rgyas pa smra ba po rnams kyi 'dod pa'i dbye bas bstan par 'dod pas nges par sbyor ba'i ngag gi don ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: now, wishing to teach the extensive meaning by the divisions of the assertions of the proponents, he says, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the definitive statement is‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: mchod sbyin dang gtong ba las byas pa'i ling nga'i don gyi skad kyi dbyings kyi don te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin dang gtong ba las byas pa'i ling nga'i don gyi skad kyi dbyings kyi don te /
translated: The meaning of the root of the word is the meaning of the word that is made from the root of the word yaj, which means sacrifice and giving.

original: bsgom pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i bsgrub bya'i ngo bo bdag nyid 'grub pa'i don du gzhan 'jug par byed pa'i phyir gcig tu 'dzud par byed pa ni nges par sbyor ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i bsgrub bya'i ngo bo bdag nyid 'grub pa'i don du gzhan 'jug par byed pa'i phyir gcig tu 'dzud par byed pa ni nges par sbyor ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the instigator is that which causes another to engage in the activity of accomplishing the nature of the object to be accomplished, which is not in accordance with meditation and characteristics.

analyzed: de nyid kyang 'bras bu dang 'brel pa can gyi 'dzud par byed pa'am /

original: de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu yang rung zhes bya ba'i ngag gi don @43a * //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu yang rung zhes bya ba'i ngag gi don @43a * //
translated: or the result that is connected with that. The meaning of the statement is

original: nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: taught by that very [word].

original: 'khrul 'khor la skyon pa la sogs pa yang de'i dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor la skyon pa la sogs pa yang de'i dbye ba yin no //
translated: The one who sets the machine in motion, etc. are also its varieties.

original: skyes bu kha cig la 'jug par gyis sgrub par gyis zhes bya ba ni de'i bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu kha cig la 'jug par gyis sgrub par gyis zhes bya ba ni de'i bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of that is engage one person, accomplish!

original: sgra ni 'jug pa dang / byed pa dang / sgrub pa de rnams kyi byed pa po dang / smra ba po yin pa'i phyir snga phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni 'jug pa dang / byed pa dang / sgrub pa de rnams kyi byed pa po dang / smra ba po yin pa'i phyir snga phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: The word is the agent of those engagements, actions, and accomplishments, and the speaker, therefore it is not sequential.

original: sgra ni byed pa po yin la de'i byed pa ni bya ba la yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni byed pa po yin la de'i byed pa ni bya ba la yin te /

original: bya bar gyur pa ni skyes bu'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya bar gyur pa ni skyes bu'i bya ba'o //

analyzed: bshad pa thams cad la yod pa can la de du bar byed pa la sogs pa'i don du smra ba'o //

original: bya ba nyid kyi byed pa ni byed pa po'i rang gi bya ba dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i shes pa yin pa bzhin bya ba gzhan no //
analyzed: bya ba nyid kyi byed pa ni byed pa po'i rang gi bya ba dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i shes pa yin pa bzhin bya ba gzhan no //

original: skad kyi dbyings kyis rang gi don bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: skad kyi dbyings kyis rang gi don bstan pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the verbal root is taught by the verbal root.

original: de yang mi shes pa 'jug pa'i yul nyid kyis shes par byed pa ni ling nga la sogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan bzhin du bsgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //

original: skad cig dbyings kyis don nyid ni ling da la sogs pa yod pa'i bsgrub bya nyid kyis rtogs ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig dbyings kyis don nyid ni ling da la sogs pa yod pa'i bsgrub bya nyid kyis rtogs ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the verbal root is not understood by the verbal root itself, because it is the object of proof, like the verbal root, etc.

original: rang dngos po las don sgrub byed na ste 'dod pa ni sgrub par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: rang dngos po las don sgrub byed na ste 'dod pa ni sgrub par bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: If the meaning is established from the thing itself, then the assertion is taught as the establishment.

original: 'di la nges par sbyor ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la nges par sbyor ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is called ‚Äúdefinite application.‚Äù

original: rnam pa du ma de dag thams cad blo la ji ltar snang bas nye bar bslad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma de dag thams cad blo la ji ltar snang bas nye bar bslad pa yin gyi /

analyzed: don gyi de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin las ni ma yin no //

analyzed: rang dngos po las don sgrub byed na ste 'dod pa sgrubs pa yin nam /
translated: If the object is established from its own nature, is it established as desired?

original: mi 'byung ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ste /üîΩskyes bu'i don ma yin pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu'i don gyi rgyu yang ma yin pa'i phyir dang ste bdag nyid med pa las don te /
analyzed: mi 'byung ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ste / skyes bu'i don ma yin pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu'i don gyi rgyu yang ma yin pa'i phyir dang ste bdag nyid med pa las don te /
translated: If it does not occur, it will not arise.üîΩBecause it is not the purpose of a person and because it is not the cause of the purpose of a person, the purpose from the absence of self is established as desired.üîΩBecause it is not the purpose of a person and because it is not the establishment of that,

original: 'dod pa'i sgrub byed de bya ba sgrub pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir de ni skyes bu don ma yin zhing de sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sgrub byed de bya ba sgrub pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir de ni skyes bu don ma yin zhing de sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: it is not the purpose of a person and it is not the establishment of that.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi yul la yang yod pa'i rig byed kyi don dam pa'i sbyor ba dang / mtho ris dag bdag nyid kyis yul ma yin pa la 'brel pa nye bar bstan pa nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam gyi yul la yang yod pa'i rig byed kyi don dam pa'i sbyor ba dang / mtho ris dag bdag nyid kyis yul ma yin pa la 'brel pa nye bar bstan pa nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the Vedas is not established as the ultimate object of mere conceptual thought, and it is not possible to demonstrate a connection with a heaven that is not an object.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúestablishes‚Äù should be applied to each [of the three reasons].

original: de rnams thams cad 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: de rnams thams cad 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if all of them were not the cause of desire,

original: gang kho na sgrub par byed par 'dod pa nyid rigs pas rtogs pa de kho na nyid dag gi don yin du @43b zad mod /
analyzed: gang kho na sgrub par byed par 'dod pa nyid rigs pas rtogs pa de kho na nyid dag gi don yin du @43b zad mod /
translated: only that which is established as the cause of desire by reasoning is the meaning of the Vedas.

original: 'di la de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, he says ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: de rnams las gcig kyang de'i rgyu nyid du mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pas rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams las gcig kyang de'i rgyu nyid du mngon sum la sogs pa'i rigs pas rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: None of them is understood as its cause by reasoning such as perception,

analyzed: 'di'i rgyud pa'i 'brel pa thams cad du rnyed par sla bar rigs pa yin pa'i phyir bye brag med do //
translated: because it is reasonable that the connection in its continuum would be easily found everywhere, and there is no distinction.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /

original: sgra de ni gang ji ltar brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra de ni gang ji ltar brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That sound is called ‚Äúwhatever is expressed.‚Äù

original: gsal bar rnyed pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gsal bar rnyed pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi tshad ma yin gyi /

analyzed: gsal bar byas pa'i yul la dgos pa grub par byed pa nyid yin nam /
translated: Is the object that is made clear the one that accomplishes the purpose,üîΩor is it another?

analyzed: gzhan yin nam zhes 'gro ba byas nas 'jug par 'dod pa can 'jug pa'am mi 'jug pa yin gyi /

analyzed: rig byed ni gsal bar byas pa'i yul yin na tshad ma'i bya ba rdzogs pa yin te /

analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyis yul la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of objects of valid cognition:üîΩthe one that establishes what is desired and the one that is the agent of engagement.

original: 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa dang / 'dzud pa por rang bzhin gcig par yin par 'dir smra ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa dang / 'dzud pa por rang bzhin gcig par yin par 'dir smra ba ni /
translated: Here, it is said that they are of the same nature.

original: nges sbyar nyid kyis 'jug ce na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nges sbyar nyid kyis 'jug ce na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If one engages by mere connection,

analyzed: nges par sbyor ba ni lag pas gnya' bzung byas pa dang / mtshungs par 'gro ba thams cad la thun mong yin te /
translated: The definite application is like the hand grasping the neck, and the commonality of all going.

analyzed: thams cad la yang shin tu drag pa'i rlung bzhin du mthar thug par 'dzud par byed pa yin pa ni gegs byed pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: And it is the one who causes all to enter into the ultimate, like a very strong wind, because there is no obstruction.üîΩThe meaning is that there is no obstruction of the obstruction of error, etc.

original: phyin ci log pa la sogs pas gegs byed pa'i gegs byed pa rnams med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa la sogs pas gegs byed pa'i gegs byed pa rnams med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that is stated:

original: de yang / de'i phyir rig byed sgron ma bzhin //

analyzed: phyi rol nyid du zhen pa'i yul nyid du zhen pas sgro btags pa'i brjod bya yin te /
translated: It is the expressed object that is superimposed because it is superimposed as an object that is external.

original: tshad ma rnam par nges pa las /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par nges pa las /
translated: In Ascertainment of Valid Knowledge,

original: rang gi so sor snang ba ni don ma yin pa la don du zhen pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: rang gi so sor snang ba ni don ma yin pa la don du zhen pa zhes smos te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThe appearance of each individual thing is the superimposition of an object on what is not an object.‚Äù

original: don ma yin pa nyid ni sgro btags pa nyid ni gzung ba'i rnam pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don ma yin pa nyid ni sgro btags pa nyid ni gzung ba'i rnam pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúwhat is not an object is a superimposition‚Äù teaches that the aspect of the object of knowledge is not different from the aspect of the object of knowledge.

original: @50b mchod sbyin la sogs pa gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: @50b mchod sbyin la sogs pa gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is like saying, ‚ÄúMake an offering to Agni and so on.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi don byed pa ni sgra las nges par byed pa yin gyi sgro btags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don byed pa ni sgra las nges par byed pa yin gyi sgro btags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The function of an external object is to bring about ascertainment from a word, but it is not a superimposition.

original: de nyid kyis ni 'jug pa yin gyi sgro btags pas rang dbang du gtogs pa yin na ni phyi rol la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni 'jug pa yin gyi sgro btags pas rang dbang du gtogs pa yin na ni phyi rol la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: It is just that which engages, not something else that is imagined to be autonomous.

original: tshad ma rnam par nges pa las /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par nges pa las /
translated: In the Ascertainment of Valid Knowledge,

original: 'di ni bum pa zhes shes la kha dog snang phyir ro zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bum pa zhes shes la kha dog snang phyir ro zhes smos pa'o //
translated: it says, This is the knowledge of a pot, because the color appears.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid ma rtogs pa ni sgro btags pa'i phyi rol nyid do zhes pa'i mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid ma rtogs pa ni sgro btags pa'i phyi rol nyid do zhes pa'i mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa yin na /
translated: If the engagement is due to the conception that the variety is not realized, and the engagement is due to the conception that it is external,üîΩthen the conception of external objects in the aspect of the apprehended is imputed,

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyi rol du zhen pa ni btags pa pa yin la /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyi rol du zhen pa ni btags pa pa yin la /
translated: and the conception of external objects in the aspect of the apprehender is imagined.

original: gzhan gyi ni phyi rol nyid du sgro btags pa nyid yin yang de la yang gzhan nyid yin gyi phyi rol ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni phyi rol nyid du sgro btags pa nyid yin yang de la yang gzhan nyid yin gyi phyi rol ni ma yin la /
translated: Even though the latter is imagined to be external, it is not external.

original: slar yang btags pa yang gzhan nyid yin na thug pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med pas phyi rol la 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: slar yang btags pa yang gzhan nyid yin na thug pa med pa'i phyir rtogs pa med pas phyi rol la 'jug pa med do //
translated: If the imputed were also different, there would be an infinite regress, and there would be no engagement with external objects, because there would be no realization.

original: rtogs pa yin na yul ni de'i bdag nyid kyis phrad pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs pa yin na yul ni de'i bdag nyid kyis phrad pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there were realization, the object would be contacted by its nature. This is the meaning.

original: phyi rol gyi shes pa yin na de nyid rtogs pa dang 'jug pa'i yul yin du zad mod /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi shes pa yin na de nyid rtogs pa dang 'jug pa'i yul yin du zad mod /
translated: If it were an external consciousness, it would be exhausted in the object of realization and engagement.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pas ci zhig bya ba bstan pa ni byed pa po nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pas ci zhig bya ba bstan pa ni byed pa po nyid kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of what is done by the apprehender of the aspect of the object is ‚Äúthe agent itself.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa po tsam yin gyi nye ba na gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs pa po tsam yin gyi nye ba na gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is merely the realizer, not the one who abides nearby.

original: gang dag byung gyur de nyid las zhes bya ba'i rigs pas de nyid ji ltar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag byung gyur de nyid las zhes bya ba'i rigs pas de nyid ji ltar ma yin zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that since it is the principle that ‚Äúwhatever has arisen arises from itself,‚Äù how could it not be so,

original: rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said ‚Äúat the time of realization.‚Äù

original: byed pa po ma yin pa las cig shos ni gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa las cig shos ni gzhan yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The other, which is not the agent, is different. This is the meaning.

original: de lta min na bya ba'i dngos po nye ba ma yin pa nyid rtogs par byed pa ni sgra yin te /
analyzed: de lta min na bya ba'i dngos po nye ba ma yin pa nyid rtogs par byed pa ni sgra yin te /
translated: Otherwise, the thing to be done is not nearby. It is the sound that causes the realization.

original: de yang / yang na gang zhig smra ba po //üîΩzhes rang dbang du brjod pa ste snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de yang / yang na gang zhig smra ba po // zhes rang dbang du brjod pa ste snyam du sems pa la /
translated: And that is expressed independently, as in ‚Äúthe one who speaks.‚Äù

original: sgras sngar ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgras sngar ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thinking this, it is said ‚Äúthe sound that causes the realization of what was not previously realized.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa ma bzung bar ni sus kyang sgra las don rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma bzung bar ni sus kyang sgra las don rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: No one can understand the meaning of a word without grasping its relation.

original: 'on te tshig nyid ni ngag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te tshig nyid ni ngag ma yin te /
translated: But a word is not a sentence.

original: tshig gi don las 'brel pa mi shes pa rnams the tshom dang ldan pa rnams las ngag gi don shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshig gi don las 'brel pa mi shes pa rnams the tshom dang ldan pa rnams las ngag gi don shes pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of a sentence is understood by those who are in doubt about the meaning of the words, because they do not know the relation of the words to their meaning.

original: de'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa na /
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa na /
translated: But it is not dependent on grasping the relation of the words to their meaning.

original: gang gis sngar zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩbyed pa po'i tshig las bya ba dang bcas pa'i tshig gi don sngar rtogs pa kho na rtogs bya yin gyi gzhan du ni ma @51a * //
analyzed: gang gis sngar zhes bya ba smos so // byed pa po'i tshig las bya ba dang bcas pa'i tshig gi don sngar rtogs pa kho na rtogs bya yin gyi gzhan du ni ma @51a * //
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúBy whom was it previously understood?‚Äù

original: yin te ; byed pa po nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te ; byed pa po nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of a word with an action is understood only previously to the meaning of the word ‚Äúhe,‚Äù because it is not tenable that the agent is the object.

original: de lta yin dang byed pa po yang 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang byed pa po yang 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the agent would also be the object.

original: de ltar sngar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sngar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is observed in that way.

original: de bzhin du 'phangs pa'i bye brag can ni nye ba na gnas pa'i bya ba 'phen pa yin par ci las shes she na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phangs pa'i bye brag can ni nye ba na gnas pa'i bya ba 'phen pa yin par ci las shes she na /
translated: In the same way, how do you know that the action of the one who is the object is projected by the verb?

original: de bzhin du sngar dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngar dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Likewise, because of prior observation.

original: de lta na nye ba ni gnas pa dang rung ba la ltos pa nyid ni tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta na nye ba ni gnas pa dang rung ba la ltos pa nyid ni tshogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, proximity is dependent on abiding and suitability, which is the collection.

original: de nyid ni de las gzhan pa las tha dad pa yin zhes bya ba ni sngon dang phyi ma nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni de las gzhan pa las tha dad pa yin zhes bya ba ni sngon dang phyi ma nyid do //
translated: That itself is different from the other, which is prior and posterior.

original: des na ngag gi don yang sngar mthong ba la brten pa nyid du shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsngar mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba med na sgra las rtogs pa yang med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'am /
analyzed: des na ngag gi don yang sngar mthong ba la brten pa nyid du shes par bya zhes bya ba'i don to // sngar mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba med na sgra las rtogs pa yang med pa kho na yin pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement is to be understood as ‚Äúbased on prior seeing.‚Äù

original: phyi rol yang rung rang dbang du 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol yang rung rang dbang du 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there were no following of prior seeing, there would be no understanding from words at all, and so it is said that ‚Äúthere is no apprehension of the external as independent, whether it is superimposed or not.‚Äù

original: snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas mthong ba dang snang bzhin pa thun mong pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas mthong ba dang snang bzhin pa thun mong pa nyid kyis rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: It is understood through the commonality of seeing and what is presently appearing, following the prior.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i yul can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i yul can ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a subject that has an uncommon object.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni dngos po yin te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni dngos po yin te /
translated: The uncommon is the entity.

original: de ma thag tu dmigs pa dang gzhan pa'i dngos po'i don byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu dmigs pa dang gzhan pa'i dngos po'i don byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen that the object of apprehension and the object that performs a function are different.

original: de yang de ma yin pa las log pa'i ngo bo'i rjes su 'brang ba can ni thun mong ba'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang de ma yin pa las log pa'i ngo bo'i rjes su 'brang ba can ni thun mong ba'i shes pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the cognition that is common to all is that which follows the nature that is the opposite of what is not that.

original: rang gi snang ba'i rnam pa don med pa don las gzhan pa la gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa don mthong ba las 'ongs pa la don nyid du mngon par zhen pas skyes bu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir cha gang gis dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin pa
analyzed: rang gi snang ba'i rnam pa don med pa don las gzhan pa la gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa don mthong ba las 'ongs pa la don nyid du mngon par zhen pas skyes bu 'jug par byed pa'i phyir cha gang gis dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin pa
translated: Because a person engages in the object that is the cause of the appearance of the aspect of itself, which is different from the object, through the conception of the object as the object that is transmitted from one to another, the object that is seen is the object itself.

original: des der mngon par zhen pas 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba'i yul can du bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des der mngon par zhen pas 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba'i yul can du bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it is the cause of engagement through the conception of that as that, it is taught that it has the object of the exclusion of other.

original: snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to teach this, he says, ‚Äúfollowing the former.‚Äù

original: nges pa can las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: nges pa can las skyes pa'am /
translated: It arises from a definite object.

original: nges pa can gyi sgra las skyes pa yang rung ba'i rnam par shes pa yang gzhan las log pa'i ngo bos 'jug pa'i yul ni dngos po yin par rnam par gzhag pa yin na gzhan sel ba'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa can gyi sgra las skyes pa yang rung ba'i rnam par shes pa yang gzhan las log pa'i ngo bos 'jug pa'i yul ni dngos po yin par rnam par gzhag pa yin na gzhan sel ba'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, a consciousness that arises from a definite word engages an object that is a thing by way of an aspect that is the opposite of other things.üîΩThis is not a mere word, but it is not a perception that touches a thing, because it is said that the object of engagement is like that.

original: 'di ni tshig tsam las byung ba dngos po la reg pa ma yin pa'i snang ba ni 'jug pa'i yul la de ltar rjod par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan sel ba'i @51b yul can yin snyam du sems pa la mi 'da'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshig tsam las byung ba dngos po la reg pa ma yin pa'i snang ba ni 'jug pa'i yul la de ltar rjod par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan sel ba'i @51b yul can yin snyam du sems pa la mi 'da'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One should not think that it is an object of other-exclusion.

original: nges pa can las byung ba la sogs pa nyid gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin par ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: nges pa can las byung ba la sogs pa nyid gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin par ni bden mod kyi /
translated: It is true that that which arises from a definite word and so on is an object of other-exclusion.

original: 'di ni de lta bu ma yin yang brgyud pas dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir de ltar bstan par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu ma yin yang brgyud pas dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir de ltar bstan par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But although this is not like that, it is possible to teach it in that way because it is preceded by the seeing of a thing by way of a continuum.

original: sngar mthong ba'i dngos po rnams bsgrub bya nyid dam /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i dngos po rnams bsgrub bya nyid dam /
translated: Previously seen things are established as the object of engagement.

original: sgrub byed nyid kyis rjes su 'brangs nas tshig gi dngos po la reg pas dngos su bya ba'i bsgrub bya dang / sgrub byed nyid kyis ngo bos rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgrub byed nyid kyis rjes su 'brangs nas tshig gi dngos po la reg pas dngos su bya ba'i bsgrub bya dang / sgrub byed nyid kyis ngo bos rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: The object of engagement is the object of engagement that is directly engaged by the object of engagement itself, because it is directly engaged by the object of engagement itself.üîΩThe object of engagement is the object of engagement that is indirectly engaged by the object of engagement itself, because it is indirectly engaged by the object of engagement itself.üîΩThe object of engagement is the object of engagement that is engaged by the object of engagement itself, because it is engaged by the object of engagement itself.

analyzed: de dag tsam gyis ltos pa dang bcas pa 'jug pa yin gyi 'jug pa'i yul mtho ris sgrub par byed pa la / de'i byed pa po nyid dam tshad mar bstan pa la mi 'jug pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la thams cad du zhes bya ba smos te /
