original: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i yul btang nas spyir btang ba la 'jug par bya ste /üîΩdes na shes pa'i rgyu'i bye brag can tshad @67a * //üîΩma ma yin pa med pa can gyis tshad ma nyid bskyed par bya ba yin gyi bye brag de yang shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i yul btang nas spyir btang ba la 'jug par bya ste / des na shes pa'i rgyu'i bye brag can tshad @67a * // ma ma yin pa med pa can gyis tshad ma nyid bskyed par bya ba yin gyi bye brag de yang shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Having abandoned the object of the exception, one should engage in the general statement.

original: de med par yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the particular cause of consciousness, which is not without valid knowledge, generates valid knowledge. But that particularity is not the nature of consciousness itself, because it arises even without that.

original: de nyid kyis ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa tsam ni tshad ma nyid kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa tsam ni tshad ma nyid kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mere determination of its own nature is not the effect of a valid cognition,

original: tshad ma ma yin pa la yang yod pas the tshom can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa la yang yod pas the tshom can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists even in a non-valid cognition, and because it is doubtful.

original: bye brag ma mthong na thag ring po la mtho yor dang mir lta ba po rnam par dpyod pa na /
analyzed: bye brag ma mthong na thag ring po la mtho yor dang mir lta ba po rnam par dpyod pa na /
translated: When one is uncertain about a particular, such as when one sees a distant cairn or a man,

original: skyon gyis shes pa ma skyes na //
analyzed: skyon gyis shes pa ma skyes na //
translated: if the cognition is not produced by a fault,

original: tshad ma yin pa'i dogs pa med //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa'i dogs pa med //
translated: there is no doubt that it is a valid cognition.

original: ces bya ba tsam gyis bsal bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba tsam gyis bsal bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to eliminate it merely by saying this.

original: de lta bu'i yul rang nyid kho na skye bar rnam par dpyod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yul rang nyid kho na skye bar rnam par dpyod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one analyzes the arising of such an object itself,

original: yongs su gcod pa tsam la yang khyad par ma mthong bar bye brag med pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa tsam la yang khyad par ma mthong bar bye brag med pa yin te /
translated: there is no difference in the mere determination, because one does not see a distinction.

original: dang po ni gnod pa can med pa'i khyad par du ma nges pa yin la /
analyzed: dang po ni gnod pa can med pa'i khyad par du ma nges pa yin la /
translated: The first is uncertain as to the distinction of the absence of a fault,

original: dus phyis 'jug pa'i dus su ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir the tsho ma yin no //
analyzed: dus phyis 'jug pa'i dus su ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir the tsho ma yin no //
translated: and later, when it engages, it is not existent, so it is doubtful.

original: goms pa'i yul la ni lan cig min par 'jug pa po 'thob pa'i yod pa dang med pa dag gis mtshon pa ni ma 'khrul ba'am /
analyzed: goms pa'i yul la ni lan cig min par 'jug pa po 'thob pa'i yod pa dang med pa dag gis mtshon pa ni ma 'khrul ba'am /
translated: In the case of a familiar object, the one who engages it is not confused about the existence or nonexistence of the object, and therefore there is no reason for doubt.

original: cig shos kyi ngo bo nyid na khyad par yod pa'i phyir the tshom skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos kyi ngo bo nyid na khyad par yod pa'i phyir the tshom skye ba ma yin no //
translated: But in the case of the other kind of object, there is a difference in the nature of the object, and therefore doubt arises.

original: gnod pa can ma dmigs pa tsam las ni /
analyzed: gnod pa can ma dmigs pa tsam las ni /
translated: But in the case of the nonobservation of an incompatible object,

original: gnod pa can yod pa dang med pa'i thun mong ba las ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa can yod pa dang med pa'i thun mong ba las ma yin no //
translated: it is not common to both the existence and nonexistence of the incompatible object.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: rgyu'i skyon ma dmigs pa la yang brjod bya 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i skyon ma dmigs pa la yang brjod bya 'jug pa yin te /
translated: the nonobservation of a cause that is a fault is also applicable.

original: dang po rgyu'i skyon ma dmigs pa'i ma nges pa yin la /
analyzed: dang po rgyu'i skyon ma dmigs pa'i ma nges pa yin la /
translated: First, the nonobservation of a cause that is a fault is an instance of nonobservation that is not a sign of the nonexistence of the property of the subject.

original: phyis ni snga ma ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis ni snga ma ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Later, it is an instance of the nonestablishment of the original property.

original: kha cig tu lan cig min par 'jug pa dang / thob pa dag gis shes pa ni ma 'khrul pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa ni bye brag yin pa'i phyir de mthong ba la 'jug pa ni gnod par byed pa'i rgyu skyon ma dmigs pa las 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig tu lan cig min par 'jug pa dang / thob pa dag gis shes pa ni ma 'khrul pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa ni bye brag yin pa'i phyir de mthong ba la 'jug pa ni gnod par byed pa'i rgyu skyon ma dmigs pa las 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: In some cases, the knowledge that the object is engaged by the cognition more than once and the knowledge that the object is obtained are the nature of nonerroneous cognition. Since this is a difference, the engagement of the seeing of that object is not due to the nonobservation of a cause that is a fault.

original: de'i phyir dang por yongs su bcad pa ni don dang don ma yin pa'i thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir the tshom yin yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por yongs su bcad pa ni don dang don ma yin pa'i thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir the tshom yin yang /
translated: Therefore, first of all, the ascertainment is doubt, because it is common to both the object and the nonobject.

original: de'i tshe de nyid la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: But at that time, it is engaged in that object,

original: de ltar 'jug par yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug par yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen to be engaged in that way.

original: dus phyis ni ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa las /
analyzed: dus phyis ni ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa las /
translated: Later, it is engaged in the object through nonerroneous consciousness,

original: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na las 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na las 'jug pa yin te /
translated: because it is engaged in the nature of consciousness itself.

original: rang gi ngo bo 'dzin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo 'dzin par byed pa'am /
translated: Even though it is engaged in the nature of the object,

original: don byed pa 'dzin par byed pa la gzhan la ltos pa yin yang thug pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa 'dzin par byed pa la gzhan la ltos pa yin yang thug pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: or it is engaged in the object‚Äôs function, it is not the case that it is dependent on another, and there is no infinite regress.

original: don byed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa @67b dang / rang gi ngo bo shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / rang rig pa'i mngon sum yin pa nyid kyis the tshom bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa @67b dang / rang gi ngo bo shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / rang rig pa'i mngon sum yin pa nyid kyis the tshom bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nature of the object‚Äôs function is pleasure and so on, the nature of the object is not different from consciousness, and it is self-awareness and direct perception, and thus it eliminates doubt.

original: mngon sum la yang re zhig don gyi rang gi ngo bo snang ba can la sogs pa med na the tshom kho na yin na /
analyzed: mngon sum la yang re zhig don gyi rang gi ngo bo snang ba can la sogs pa med na the tshom kho na yin na /
translated: If direct perception does not have the appearance of the object‚Äôs own nature, then it is only doubt.

original: rig byed la ni don gyi rang gi ngo bo la reg par byed pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa tsam la ni smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: rig byed la ni don gyi rang gi ngo bo la reg par byed pa ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa tsam la ni smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: In the case of inference, it does not contact the object‚Äôs own nature, so what need is there to mention that it is mere conception?

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can nyid kyis goms pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i yul can nyid kyis goms pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a subject that is beyond the senses, it is impossible to cultivate it.

original: de dag tsam gyi rgyu bskyed par bya ba'i shes pa ni don byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de dag tsam gyi rgyu bskyed par bya ba'i shes pa ni don byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis /
translated: The consciousness that is produced by the cause of mere words does not perform a function,

original: dang po'i shes pa las khyad par med pa'i phyir rig byed la yang rjod par byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i glo ni rnam pa brgyar 'gyur ba'i phyir pha rol po'i phyogs ni rjes su mthun pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dang po'i shes pa las khyad par med pa'i phyir rig byed la yang rjod par byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i glo ni rnam pa brgyar 'gyur ba'i phyir pha rol po'i phyogs ni rjes su mthun pa ma yin la /
translated: and because it is not different from the first consciousness, the opponent‚Äôs position is not tenable, because the sound of the expression that follows the expression of the indicative would be a hundred times greater.

original: pha rol po rnams kyis mi bslu ba shes pa zhan pa tsam ni de dag tsam gyi rgyu bskyed byar brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po rnams kyis mi bslu ba shes pa zhan pa tsam ni de dag tsam gyi rgyu bskyed byar brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The opponent does not say that the mere cause of the nondeceptive consciousness is weak.

original: de lta mod kyi grang ba ldog par byed pa la sogs pa rang nyid rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi grang ba ldog par byed pa la sogs pa rang nyid rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, it is itself cognized in the process of warding off cold.

original: des na pha rol po'i dngos pos stong pa 'dren par 'dod pa tsam ni gus par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na pha rol po'i dngos pos stong pa 'dren par 'dod pa tsam ni gus par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mere desire to draw out the empty nature of the other is not to be respected.

original: goms pa med pa'i dus kyi tshad ma nyid ni gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi 'bras bu can yin te /
analyzed: goms pa med pa'i dus kyi tshad ma nyid ni gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi 'bras bu can yin te /
translated: The measure of the time of non-familiarity is itself the result of following another.

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu tsam du ni tshad ma dang cig shos mtshungs pa des na phrad par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i ngo bo ni goms pa las rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu tsam du ni tshad ma dang cig shos mtshungs pa des na phrad par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba'i ngo bo ni goms pa las rtogs pa yin la /
translated: The mere result and cause are the same as the valid cognition and the other. Therefore, the nature of non-arising without contact is realized through familiarity.

original: mthar thug par gnod pa mthong ba'am /
analyzed: mthar thug par gnod pa mthong ba'am /
translated: In the end, one sees the harm,

original: gzhan yang rung ba la 'grub pa la 'khrul pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ba la 'grub pa la 'khrul pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: or else, it is established without error.

original: de nyid ma rtogs las byung ba //
analyzed: de nyid ma rtogs las byung ba //
translated: Arising from the non-realization of that,

original: spyi yin smra rnams 'di la gnas //
analyzed: spyi yin smra rnams 'di la gnas //
translated: the proponents of universals abide in this.

original: rgyal ba can de'i ji ltar yin //üîΩtshig tu brjod pa de smra yin ;
analyzed: rgyal ba can de'i ji ltar yin // tshig tu brjod pa de smra yin ;
translated: How is it for the Vai≈õe·π£ika?

original: / zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is expressed in words is the proponent.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid chos la sogs pa rnams la tha snyad pa ma yin pa'i tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid chos la sogs pa rnams la tha snyad pa ma yin pa'i tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: The Bhagavat himself is a valid cognition that is not a conventional valid cognition with regard to phenomena and so on.

original: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes dang por khas blangs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes dang por khas blangs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Doesn‚Äôt the BhagavƒÅn himself first accept that he is a valid cognition in regard to phenomena and so on, but the other is not?

original: gang gi phyir de ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yul nyid yin no snyam sems pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yul nyid yin no snyam sems pa yin na /
translated: If you think that because he is the object of ƒ™≈õvara and so on,

original: de ni dgag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni dgag par bya ba yin no //
translated: he is to be refuted,

original: kun rdzob ni mi 'dod ces bya ba ji ltar yin /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni mi 'dod ces bya ba ji ltar yin /
translated: then how is it that you do not assert that the conventional is to be refuted?

original: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni chos la sogs pa'i yul nyid yin /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni chos la sogs pa'i yul nyid yin /
translated: The recognition of what was seen previously is the object of phenomena and so on.

original: de dang bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not established because

original: rtogs pa nyid yin pas skabs ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid yin pas skabs ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not the case that it is not the context of realization.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid dag gis gnyi ga'i ngo bo yin pa'i @68a * //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid dag gis gnyi ga'i ngo bo yin pa'i @68a * //
translated: Because both are the nature of direct perception and inference,

original: phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyang las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba mkhyen pa la rnam par rtog pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyang las dang 'bras bu 'brel ba mkhyen pa la rnam par rtog pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and because the BhagavƒÅn, in knowing the connection between karma and effects, is the principal conceptual consciousness.

original: dor ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par nyams su myong ba tsam gyis 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang rjes su mthun pa yang yin no //üîΩ'on te nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'i bcom ldan 'das ni bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: dor ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par nyams su myong ba tsam gyis 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir yang rjes su mthun pa yang yin no // 'on te nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo'i bcom ldan 'das ni bdag nyid dam /
translated: It is also suitable because it is not engaged by mere experience without conceptualization such as ‚Äúit is to be rejected‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan yang rung ba'i dus su rig pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ba'i dus su rig pa yin la /
translated: Or, the experience of the BhagavƒÅn is cognition at the time of himself or another.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de dang de ma yin pa'i dus su rig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba can yin pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de dang de ma yin pa'i dus su rig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba can yin pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Conceptualization is the cognition of that and that which is not, and it is to be clarified because it is contradictory to that.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: nyams su myong ba de ma yin pa'i yul can nyid yin na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de ma yin pa'i yul can nyid yin na /
translated: If that experience is not the object of itself,

original: de la rag las pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang 'dzin par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rag las pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang 'dzin par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then conceptualization that depends on it would not be the apprehender.

original: de la rag mi las pa nyid yin na de yod na 'byung ba ni sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nyams su myong ba yang zhen pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rag mi las pa nyid yin na de yod na 'byung ba ni sngon po'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nyams su myong ba yang zhen pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: If it does not depend on that, then its occurrence when that exists would not be like the conceptual thought of blue, and so it should be understood that experience is only the nature of attachment.

original: de ma yin pa'i dus su rig pa ni shes pa nyid kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i dus su rig pa ni shes pa nyid kho na nyid yin no //
translated: If it is known at a time when that does not exist, it is only consciousness.

original: goms par bya ba'i yul la rjes su 'jug pa la sbyangs pa yin na /
analyzed: goms par bya ba'i yul la rjes su 'jug pa la sbyangs pa yin na /
translated: If it is trained in engaging the object of cultivation,

original: mig phye ba'i mod la de nyid rtogs pa rnam par rtog pa can ma yin pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: mig phye ba'i mod la de nyid rtogs pa rnam par rtog pa can ma yin pa yod pa yin te /
translated: then the nonconceptual realization of that exists the moment the eyes open.

original: de la dran pa'i rjes su 'jug pa la sogs pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dran pa'i rjes su 'jug pa la sogs pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for it to engage memory and so on.

original: ma'am pha la yang tha snyad la bslabs pa la sogs pas goms par gyur pa ni mthong ba tsam gyis mi shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma'am pha la yang tha snyad la bslabs pa la sogs pas goms par gyur pa ni mthong ba tsam gyis mi shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, when one is accustomed to a mother or father through training in conventions and so on, it is not the case that one does not know them upon seeing them.

original: de ni 'dra bar rtogs pa yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni 'dra bar rtogs pa yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to say that is the realization of similarity.

original: sbyangs pa'i zin po ma yin na 'dra bar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i zin po ma yin na 'dra bar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were not the residue of prior training, then there would be no realization of similarity.

original: de la zin po yin na 'dra bar rtogs pa bzhin du de kho na nyid rtogs pa bsal bar byas pa ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la zin po yin na 'dra bar rtogs pa bzhin du de kho na nyid rtogs pa bsal bar byas pa ma yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it were the residue, then just as there is realization of similarity, there would be no need to eliminate the realization of reality.

original: snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs pa med na 'dra bar rtogs pa yin no //üîΩsngar nyams su myong ba'i yul nyid 'dzin pa kho na yin pa 'di ni de kho na nyid shas pa yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa can ni sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa yin la /
analyzed: snga ma'i rjes su 'brangs pa med na 'dra bar rtogs pa yin no // sngar nyams su myong ba'i yul nyid 'dzin pa kho na yin pa 'di ni de kho na nyid shas pa yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa can ni sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa yin la /
translated: If there were no following after the prior, there would be realization of similarity.üîΩThe mere apprehension of the object previously experienced is the cognition of reality. The nonconceptual is the recognition of what was seen before.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang de'i 'og tu de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon por nyams su myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa kho na bzhin du sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang de'i 'og tu de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon por nyams su myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa kho na bzhin du sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The conceptual is the subsequent thought, ‚ÄúThat is the same as that,‚Äù which is just like the conceptual thought that experiences blue. Recognition of what was seen before is twofold.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang cig shos kyi ngo bos yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs par rig pa pe ma yin @68b zhing ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang cig shos kyi ngo bos yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das ni skad cig ma nyid la sogs par rig pa pe ma yin @68b zhing ;
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is not a valid cognizer that knows momentariness and so on because he is the nature of experience that is the opposite of conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin la sgra ni yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin la sgra ni yin te /
translated: Sound is not a valid cognizer because it is not conceptual.

original: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa las skra dang don dag gi rtag pa nyid du grub pas 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa las skra dang don dag gi rtag pa nyid du grub pas 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, sound is a valid cognizer because it is established as permanent through recognition of what was seen before, since it exists in a relationship with the object.

original: yang na nyams su myong ba ni rang gi dus su rig pa yin gyi dus gzhan du ni ma yin la /
analyzed: yang na nyams su myong ba ni rang gi dus su rig pa yin gyi dus gzhan du ni ma yin la /
translated: Or, experience is awareness at the time of itself, but not at another time.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de dang de'i dus ma yin par yang rig par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de dang de'i dus ma yin par yang rig par byed pa yin te /
translated: Conceptual thought is that which makes one aware of that and that time.

original: nyams su myong ba las ni 'ba' zhig 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba las ni 'ba' zhig 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: It is only that which arises from experience.

original: de'i bya ba'i yul la yul du byed pa ni ma yin te /üîΩde yang / dang po dag pa'i dngos po las //
analyzed: de'i bya ba'i yul la yul du byed pa ni ma yin te / de yang / dang po dag pa'i dngos po las //
translated: It does not make the object of its action into an object.üîΩMoreover,

original: byung ba'i mig gi rnam shes yod //
analyzed: byung ba'i mig gi rnam shes yod //
translated: First, there is eye consciousness That arises from a pure entity.

original: ces smos pa'o //üîΩdang po zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: ces smos pa'o // dang po zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: rang gi yul la gtod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi yul la gtod par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The first, i.e., the cause, is not the directing of the mind to its object,

original: de ni dag pa'i dngos po las skyes pa zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dag pa'i dngos po las skyes pa zhes zer ba'o //
translated: because it is said to be born from a pure entity.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yul gzhan la yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yul gzhan la yin te /
translated: The conceptual is in regard to another object.

original: de yi 'og tu dngos de yang //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu dngos de yang //
translated: After that, that entityüîΩis determined by the mind that is fabricated

original: rigs stsogs rnams kyi chos rnams dang // bcos pa'i blo gang gis nges pa //üîΩde yang tshad ma nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: rigs stsogs rnams kyi chos rnams dang // bcos pa'i blo gang gis nges pa // de yang tshad ma nyid du 'dod //
translated: in regard to the dharmas of the classes, etc.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: That is also accepted as valid knowledge.

original: mngon sum ma yin zhing rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin zhing rtags med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not perception, because it is not direct, and it is not inference, because there is no logical mark.

original: nyams su myong ba khyad par can rig pa dang 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba khyad par can rig pa dang 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not contradictory to the special experience of awareness,

original: des bsgrub pa nyid rnam par rtog pas brtags pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bsgrub pa nyid rnam par rtog pas brtags pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood that what is established by that is just imagined by conceptualization.

original: rtag par rigs pas kyang nyams su myong ba de dang 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag par rigs pas kyang nyams su myong ba de dang 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not contradictory to that experience even by the reasoning of permanence,

original: dngul gyi shes pa la yang nya phyis kyi shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngul gyi shes pa la yang nya phyis kyi shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The cognition of silver is like the cognition of nacre.

original: de ltar dang po la gnod pa med pas phyi ma skye bar yang rigs pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po la nyams su myong bas mi rtag par rtogs la /
analyzed: de ltar dang po la gnod pa med pas phyi ma skye bar yang rigs pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i bdag nyid can gyi dngos po la nyams su myong bas mi rtag par rtogs la /
translated: Thus, since the first is not impaired, it is reasonable that the second arises. Therefore, one understands impermanence through experience of a thing that has the nature of both.

original: rnam par rtog pas rtag par rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma gnyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rtag par rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma gnyis grub pa yin no //
translated: Since one understands permanence through conceptual thought, the two valid cognitions other than inference are established.

original: mngon sum dang sngar mthong ba yang ngo //
analyzed: mngon sum dang sngar mthong ba yang ngo //
translated: Direct perception and memory are also like that.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /

original: nyams su myong ba nyid rnam par rtog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyid rnam par rtog par 'gyur la /

original: phyis ni dran pa gzhag par ni mi 'thad par shes pas rang nyid kyang goms par byas pa'i yul rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: phyis ni dran pa gzhag par ni mi 'thad par shes pas rang nyid kyang goms par byas pa'i yul rtogs pa yin te /

original: de yang da ltar ba tsam 'dzin pa can rtog pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang da ltar ba tsam 'dzin pa can rtog pa med pa yin la /

original: de'i nus pa las rnam par rtog pa gzhan sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i nus pa las rnam par rtog pa gzhan sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa yin no //

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa thams cad du gzhi mthun par mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs pa la bsnyon @69a * //üîΩpar nus pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i shes pa thams cad du gzhi mthun par mtshungs pa nyid du rtogs pa la bsnyon @69a * // par nus pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: It is impossible to deny that all consciousnesses of the past and future are realized to be the same in being a common locus.

original: gal te don byed par gnas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te don byed par gnas pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To this, the response is, ‚ÄúIf it is said that the object exists as a functioning thing . . .‚Äù

original: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni yan lag can la sogs pa'i shes pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni yan lag can la sogs pa'i shes pa bzung ngo //

original: lan ni / 'dir brjod pa zhes bya ba ste //

analyzed: re zhig nyams su myong ba nyid nges pa pa'i bdag nyid can yin par gang smras pa de ni mi rigs te /

original: rta'i rnam par rtog pa mthong ba'i dus su yang ba lang mthong ba las rta yin par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir dang mthong ba dang rtogs pa dag bye brag med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bye brag kyang rtogs pa las grub pa'i phyir dang /

original: don gyis go ba yin pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: don gyis go ba yin pa'i phyir yang ngo //

original: ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa yin na /

original: mthong ba sgrin po nyid yin na dran pa skye ba'i phyir mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩches mang rtul ba 'gro ba po'i rtsa'i reg pa bzhin du ma goms pa'i dus su dang / de las bzlog pa ches zin po yin ba'o //

original: 'on te goms pa la pha la sogs par sbyangs pa'i zin po yin pa'i phyir dang po nyid snang ba na mthong ba tsam gyis go ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te goms pa la pha la sogs par sbyangs pa'i zin po yin pa'i phyir dang po nyid snang ba na mthong ba tsam gyis go ba yin no //
translated: If it is the case that memory arises from the clear seeing, then at the time of training in clear seeing, memory arises from the clear seeing.

original: de la / de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la / de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the

original: pha la sogs pa dang po nyid mthong ba las rtogs pa dang / de la dgos par rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pha la sogs pa dang po nyid mthong ba las rtogs pa dang / de la dgos par rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the father, etc. are understood from seeing them for the first time, nor is it that the purpose is understood in relation to them.

original: dang po bzhin du nye ba gnas pa nyid kyis pha ni rtogs pa la sogs pa'i yul yin te /üîΩdang po phal sogs pa'i tha snyad la /
analyzed: dang po bzhin du nye ba gnas pa nyid kyis pha ni rtogs pa la sogs pa'i yul yin te / dang po phal sogs pa'i tha snyad la /
translated: The father, etc. are the objects of understanding, etc. because they exist in proximity, just as they did at the beginning.

original: snga ma nyid ltos pa ma yin la /
analyzed: snga ma nyid ltos pa ma yin la /
translated: The convention ‚Äúfather,‚Äù etc. is not based on the first instance of seeing.

original: de la dgos pa yang ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dgos pa yang ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the purpose based on that.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni der nye ba na gnas pa'i pha la sogs pa'i yul la gzung ba la 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni der nye ba na gnas pa'i pha la sogs pa'i yul la gzung ba la 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Imagination is the apprehension of the object, the father, etc. that exists in proximity,

original: nye ba na gnas pa mthong ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /üîΩde nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba de la yang pha yin par rtogs pa 'di la yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye ba na gnas pa mthong ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir / de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba de la yang pha yin par rtogs pa 'di la yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it has the object that is seen in proximity.üîΩ‚ÄúThat very one is this one‚Äù means that the father, etc. are understood in this way.

original: yang na de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni da dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni da dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, ‚Äúthat very one is this one‚Äù means that the one who is like that is this one.

original: 'dra ba nyid kyi rgyu mtshan las de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin nam /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid kyi rgyu mtshan las de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin nam /
translated: Is it because of the similarity that one says, ‚ÄúThis is that‚Äù?

original: @69b ba lang dang 'dra ba ni ba men no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: @69b ba lang dang 'dra ba ni ba men no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: A gayal is similar to a cow.

original: bden te / de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba blun po rnams la ni 'dra ba nyid la de lta bu'o zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bden te / de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba blun po rnams la ni 'dra ba nyid la de lta bu'o zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is true that the fool, in the absence of the real cow, designates the gayal as a cow, because of the similarity.

original: ba lang lta bu'i ba lang ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lang lta bu'i ba lang ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: But the gayal is not a cow.

original: shin tu 'dra ba nyid la de nyad 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni skra dang sen mo la sogs pa breg  pa yang skye ba lta bu'o //üîΩde la bar tshigs su mgo zlum du mthong ba ni gcig pa nyid la gnod pa can yin la /
analyzed: shin tu 'dra ba nyid la de nyad 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni skra dang sen mo la sogs pa breg  pa yang skye ba lta bu'o // de la bar tshigs su mgo zlum du mthong ba ni gcig pa nyid la gnod pa can yin la /
translated: When the similarity is very great, one says, ‚ÄúThis is that,‚Äù as when one says, ‚ÄúMy hair and nails are growing.‚ÄùüîΩIn the first case, the fact that one sees the head of the barber from a distance and that one does not recognize him is in contradiction with the fact that one recognizes him when he is near.

original: 'di la yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi mthong ba dag la mthar thug pa dang 'dzin pa gnod pa byed pa yin gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi mthong ba dag la mthar thug pa dang 'dzin pa gnod pa byed pa yin gyi ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the second case, the fact that one sees the beginning and the end of the hair is in contradiction with the fact that one does not see the beginning and the end of the self.

original: byed pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis rjes su bsgrub byang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis rjes su bsgrub byang byed pa yin no //
translated: The memory is produced by the apprehension of the action.

original: 'dra ba'i shes pa yang mthong ba tsam la med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i shes pa yang mthong ba tsam la med pa yin la /
translated: The cognition of similarity does not exist in mere seeing;

original: sbyangs pa'i zin po la ni 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i zin po la ni 'byung ba yin no //
translated: it exists in the memory of the object of experience.

original: zin po de la de dang gcig pa nyid du 'dzin par cis mi byed pa yin /
analyzed: zin po de la de dang gcig pa nyid du 'dzin par cis mi byed pa yin /
translated: Why does it not apprehend the object of experience as being the same as the memory?

original: rang gi dus su 'dzin pa nyid ni goms pa yod pa la yang mthong ba'i chos yin la /
analyzed: rang gi dus su 'dzin pa nyid ni goms pa yod pa la yang mthong ba'i chos yin la /
translated: The apprehension of the object of experience at the time of the memory is seen to exist even when there is no habit.

original: 'dra ba yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba yang yin no //
translated: And there is similarity.

original: rang gi dus su dang 'dra ba la zhes bya ba mthong ba la ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi dus su dang 'dra ba la zhes bya ba mthong ba la ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the object of experience is apprehended at the time of the memory and is similar to the memory?

original: de lta bu med kyang 'dra bar rtogs pa la sngon po lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu med kyang 'dra bar rtogs pa la sngon po lta bu'o //
translated: Even though it does not exist in that way, it is understood as similar, as in the case of blue.

original: de kho na nyid du ni de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir brgyar goms pas kyang rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du ni de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir brgyar goms pas kyang rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, it is not understood even through a hundred habits, because it is not the object of that memory.

original: mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dag gi goms pa yin yang bzang po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'dra bar brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dag gi goms pa yin yang bzang po ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'dra bar brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not said that the similarity of the characteristics of the dissimilar and the dissimilarity of the characteristics of the similar are the same.

original: de nye ba yin yang de'i gcig pa nyid ni nye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de nye ba yin yang de'i gcig pa nyid ni nye ba ma yin la /
translated: Even though it is close, the similarity of that is not close.

original: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ma yin pa nye ba yin yang /
analyzed: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ma yin pa nye ba yin yang /
translated: Even though the dissimilarity of that is close, which is dissimilar to that,

original: de ni ma yin pa'i phyir de dag 'dzin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de ni ma yin pa'i phyir de dag 'dzin pa ma yin na /
translated: it is not that, so it is not apprehended by that.

original: mngon sum ji ltar rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: mngon sum ji ltar rtogs pa yin /
translated: How is it that perception is understood?

original: de bzhin du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan nyid mi mthun pa yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, it is also dissimilar.

original: dngos po kun la tha dad dang / tha dad min gzhan ldog pa nyid ni rang gi ngo bo tsam rig pa las so //
analyzed: dngos po kun la tha dad dang / tha dad min gzhan ldog pa nyid ni rang gi ngo bo tsam rig pa las so //
translated: The difference and non-difference of all things is just the awareness of their own nature.

original: des na yang rdzas re re zhing tha dad pa'i ngo bor dmigs pa'i phyir 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yang rdzas re re zhing tha dad pa'i ngo bor dmigs pa'i phyir 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because each substance is observed to have a different nature, this [perception] is completely lost.

original: de'i phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa las snga ma dang phyi ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir mthong ba kun rdzob ma yin pa ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzung ba 'dzin pa las snga ma dang phyi ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir mthong ba kun rdzob ma yin pa ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because the former and latter subjects have as their objects the apprehended and apprehender, respectively, it is the intention that seeing is not a concealer and is not conceptual.

original: de nyid la 'di yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par byed pa yin zhing 'di yin no zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin no //üîΩdes @70a * //
analyzed: de nyid la 'di yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par byed pa yin zhing 'di yin no zhes bya ba yang de nyid yin no // des @70a * //
translated: It is that which causes one to understand ‚Äúthis is that,‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù is just that.

original: na shes pa gnyis dag gi yul gcig nyid yin na ji ltar 'dra ba'i yul can nyid dam /
analyzed: na shes pa gnyis dag gi yul gcig nyid yin na ji ltar 'dra ba'i yul can nyid dam /
translated: Therefore, if the object of the two consciousnesses is the same, how could they be the same in having similar objects?

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i yul can nyid yin shes pa'i gcig pa nyid dam du ma nyid kyang dgongs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i yul can nyid yin shes pa'i gcig pa nyid dam du ma nyid kyang dgongs pa can ma yin te /
translated: Or how could they be different in having dissimilar objects? The intention is that the singularity or multiplicity of consciousnesses is also not tenable.

original: rtogs bzhin pa ni gcig pa nyid la log par rtogs pa'i phyir de yang bsal ba yin pa ni 'on te snga ma dang lhan cig gcig tu rtogs so zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa ni gcig pa nyid la log par rtogs pa'i phyir de yang bsal ba yin pa ni 'on te snga ma dang lhan cig gcig tu rtogs so zhes zer ba la /
translated: If it is said that the one that is being cognized is singular, then the misconception is eliminated. If it is said that the former is cognized simultaneously with the latter,

original: lan du / de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan du / de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the response is ‚ÄúThat is not tenable.‚Äù

original: gcig pa nyid du rtogs pa ni mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du rtogs pa ni mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the realization of identity is not direct perception is:

original: mngon sum las sngon rig med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum las sngon rig med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no prior awareness from direct perception.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yin te /
translated: It is conceptual,

original: goms pa yin na snga ma snga ma brdzun pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis don gcig byed pa nyid kyis rgyu mtshan byas nas /
analyzed: goms pa yin na snga ma snga ma brdzun pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis don gcig byed pa nyid kyis rgyu mtshan byas nas /
translated: because if there is familiarity, the previous one, by the power of the false latent tendencies, having served as the reason for the performance of a single purpose,

original: yi ge ga la sogs pa rnams la go ba'i sgrar shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yi ge ga la sogs pa rnams la go ba'i sgrar shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: it is like the cognition of the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù in the letters ‚Äúga‚Äù and so on.

original: de la yang yi ge ga la sogs pa las ldog par dmigs pa nyid ni gnod pa can yin la /
analyzed: de la yang yi ge ga la sogs pa las ldog par dmigs pa nyid ni gnod pa can yin la /
translated: And in that case, the very observation of the reversal from the letters ‚Äúga‚Äù and so on is the fault.

analyzed: de ni 'di la yang bye brag med par yin pa can bstan pa ni / des nas ma snga ma yi //

original: snga ma snga ma'i bag chags tsam las 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog par go bar byed pa nyid kyi dgongs pas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i bag chags tsam las 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog par go bar byed pa nyid kyi dgongs pas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The thought is that it is taught by the mere latent tendencies of the former.

original: kun rdzob ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa kha cig ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa kha cig ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The thought is that it is

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba la 'dzin pa ste kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba la 'dzin pa ste kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the apprehension of the object, it is called conventional.

original: gzhan yang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not anything else.

original: yang na mngon sum ni mthong ba tsam las tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na mngon sum ni mthong ba tsam las tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, perception is not a valid cognition merely from the point of view of seeing,

original: mthong ba rnam pa thams cad yul yin pa nyid kyi bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba rnam pa thams cad yul yin pa nyid kyi bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because seeing is not a valid cognition in all cases, due to the absence of a distinction in the object.

original: khyad par can gyi rnam par nges pa ni yul nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rnam par nges pa ni yul nyid yin no //
translated: A qualified ascertainment is the object.

original: nges @70b pa yang chos dang rtags dang 'brel pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa las yin no //
analyzed: nges @70b pa yang chos dang rtags dang 'brel pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa las yin no //
translated: Ascertainment is also from inference, because perception is not the only means of knowing the connection between a property and its evidence, etc.

original: mngon sum ni tha dad pa ma yin par nges pa med kyang so sor snang bzhin pa'i don la nges pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni tha dad pa ma yin par nges pa med kyang so sor snang bzhin pa'i don la nges pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: Even though perception does not ascertain a difference, it is a valid cognition because it produces an ascertainment of an object that appears individually.

original: 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi bya ba ni mngon sum gyi bya ba'i rjes su 'brang bas nye bar rtogs pa'i bya ba btang nas rnam par rtog pa skye ba ni /
analyzed: 'di mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi bya ba ni mngon sum gyi bya ba'i rjes su 'brang bas nye bar rtogs pa'i bya ba btang nas rnam par rtog pa skye ba ni /
translated: The statement this is seen is the activity of perception, and the activity of perception is followed by the activity of ascertainment. The conceptual cognition that arises after giving up the activity of ascertainment is as follows.

original: 'di ni sngon po yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes ldog pa gcig gsal por byed kyi gzhan ni ma yin te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon po yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes ldog pa gcig gsal por byed kyi gzhan ni ma yin te nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It makes one instance of exclusion clear, such as this is blue, not yellow, but not the other, because there is no certainty.

original: mngon sum ni de skyed par byed pa las tshad ma yin te ;
analyzed: mngon sum ni de skyed par byed pa las tshad ma yin te ;
translated: Perception is a valid cognition because it produces that [ascertainment].

original: de gsal bar byed pa rnams kyi yul du de gnas pa yin na zhes bya ba ni ldog pa gcig la nges pa'i mthar thug pa yin la /
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa rnams kyi yul du de gnas pa yin na zhes bya ba ni ldog pa gcig la nges pa'i mthar thug pa yin la /
translated: If it were the object of those [conceptual cognitions] that make it clear, it would be permanent, means that it is the final ascertainment of one instance of exclusion.

original: 'di'i yang bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //üîΩgzhan du na sngon po'i yod pa nyid skad cig ma yin pa nyid kho na nges pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i yang bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yin no // gzhan du na sngon po'i yod pa nyid skad cig ma yin pa nyid kho na nges pa'i phyir skad cig ma nyid du sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the activity of that [perception] is inference.üîΩOtherwise, because the existence of blue would be ascertained as momentary alone, it would not serve to establish momentariness, because it would be contradictory.

original: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not even the case that [perception] is not [a valid cognition].

original: ma grub pa'i phyir de skad cig ma nyid dang bral ba ni tshad mar nges pa ma rtogs pa gcig la thug pa can ni tshad ma'i bya ba la don byed nus pa'i cha yul la 'jug par byed pa yin gyi yul gzhan la ni ma yin no
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyir de skad cig ma nyid dang bral ba ni tshad mar nges pa ma rtogs pa gcig la thug pa can ni tshad ma'i bya ba la don byed nus pa'i cha yul la 'jug par byed pa yin gyi yul gzhan la ni ma yin no
translated: Because it is not established, it is free from being momentary. The ascertainment of valid cognition is based on a single cognition. The function of valid cognition is to engage with the aspect of an object that is able to perform a function, not with other objects.

original: // des na yul gyi cha sngon po la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du nges pa can yang de'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: // des na yul gyi cha sngon po la 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du nges pa can yang de'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it engages with the blue aspect of the object, it is certain that it is not momentary.

original: des na tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is contradicted by another valid cognition.

original: de ltar na mngon sum dang 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum dang 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: In that case, it is not even contradictory to direct perception,

original: 'di'i nus pa'i cha'i mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i nus pa'i cha'i mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the ultimate aspect of its potential.

original: mngon sum ni yul la rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni yul la rnam par rtog pa'i gzhan yin la /
translated: Direct perception is different from conceptual thought regarding its object.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang mngon sum gyi bdag nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang mngon sum gyi bdag nyid yin gyi /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is of the nature of direct perception,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi yul la mthong ba kho na bzhin du ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi yul la mthong ba kho na bzhin du ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: but it is not as if he sees all aspects of the object.

original: shes de dag gi bzung don la //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shes de dag gi bzung don la // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The object of those cognitions isüîΩThe object of those cognitions is the object of the conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid ni mthong ba'i gzhan dbang yin gyi /üîΩmthong bas rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i cha la ni de'i ming la sogs pa dran pa med na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid ni mthong ba'i gzhan dbang yin gyi / mthong bas rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i cha la ni de'i ming la sogs pa dran pa med na /
translated: Conceptualization is dependent on seeing,üîΩbut it is not dependent on seeing in the sense of being established by seeing.

original: de la sbyor ba byed pa'i bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba byed pa'i bdag nyid rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If memory of the name, etc. of the object does not occur, then conceptualization, which is the nature of application to the object, does not occur.

original: ma mthong ba ni sbyor bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad pa'i yul mthong ba yin @71a * //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni sbyor bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad pa'i yul mthong ba yin @71a * //
translated: Since nonseeing is not application, it is not a valid cognition.

original: yang ; ches zin pa ni rnam pa gang dang gang la de'i ming la sogs pa dran pa nyid kyis nges par skyed par byed pa ni rnam pa de la tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang ; ches zin pa ni rnam pa gang dang gang la de'i ming la sogs pa dran pa nyid kyis nges par skyed par byed pa ni rnam pa de la tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, a valid cognition is that which ascertains the object in regard to the aspect in which the name, etc. of the object are remembered.

original: rnam pa tshogs pa rnams la tshad ma gcig nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa tshogs pa rnams la tshad ma gcig nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not that a single valid cognition ascertains the collection of aspects.

original: gang gis don byed pa'i nus pa can nyid du mthong ba yod pa yang skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du nges pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gis don byed pa'i nus pa can nyid du mthong ba yod pa yang skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du nges pa yin la /
translated: That which is seen to have the capacity to perform a function is ascertained to be momentary.

original: yod pa nyid dang skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du yang so sor nges pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ji ltar yod pa 'ba' zhig gi gtan tshigs ma yin zhing ji ltar 'gal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid du yang so sor nges pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ji ltar yod pa 'ba' zhig gi gtan tshigs ma yin zhing ji ltar 'gal ba nyid yin te /
translated: Because of being ascertained individually as existent and as not being momentary, how can it not be a reason for mere existence? And how can it be contradictory?

original: skad cig ma ma yin par nges pa la tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin par nges pa la tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being harmed by a valid cognition in ascertaining non-momentariness.

original: gang cha shas mthong ba la mi zin pa de la nges pa'i rgyu mtshan rjes su dpag pa yin la /
analyzed: gang cha shas mthong ba la mi zin pa de la nges pa'i rgyu mtshan rjes su dpag pa yin la /
translated: That which is not apprehended in seeing a part is ascertained by inference, the reason.

original: de la rtags med na tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtags med na tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is no reason, it is not a valid cognition.

original: rang nyid dam gzhan yang rung ba'i rjes su dpag pas nges pa'i dngos po la goms pa phul du byung pas /
analyzed: rang nyid dam gzhan yang rung ba'i rjes su dpag pas nges pa'i dngos po la goms pa phul du byung pas /
translated: Through the superior cultivation of the ascertained object by oneself or another through inference,

original: rim gyis rnam pa thams cad pa'i mngon sum rtogs pa med pa de lta ba bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis rnam pa thams cad pa'i mngon sum rtogs pa med pa de lta ba bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the non-conceptual direct perception of all aspects arises in the same way.

original: mthong ba'i bya ba ni yan lag med pa'i phyir gcig yin yang du ma nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i bya ba ni yan lag med pa'i phyir gcig yin yang du ma nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
translated: Although the act of seeing is one because it is partless, it is posited as multiple.

original: nges pa skyed par byed pa dang mi byed pa bzhin du'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa skyed par byed pa dang mi byed pa bzhin du'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is like something that generates ascertainment and something that does not.

original: de ltar na de gnas skabs pa'i tshad ma nyid dang 'gal ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na de gnas skabs pa'i tshad ma nyid dang 'gal ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that conceptual thought is not a valid cognition because it contradicts the nature of a valid cognition that is a state of affairs,

original: de med kyang de dang rjes su mthun pa mthong ba la yin te /
analyzed: de med kyang de dang rjes su mthun pa mthong ba la yin te /
translated: he says that even though it does not exist, it is seen to be similar to it.

original: tshad ma nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa zlog par byed pa smra ba ni /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa zlog par byed pa smra ba ni /
translated: The thought is that it is a valid cognition because it is seen.üîΩThe statement that refutes this is ‚ÄúIf the former is not the latter‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gal te snga ma ngang phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te snga ma ngang phyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: mthong ba ni goms pa med na 'jug par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba ni goms pa med na 'jug par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Seeing is not engaged in the absence of familiarity.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni mthong ba la snga ma gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa can ni 'jug par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni mthong ba la snga ma gcig pa nyid du 'dzin pa can ni 'jug par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Conceptual thought is not engaged in apprehending the former as the same as the latter.

original: de yang yul de la de bzhin du goms pa na mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa yin na goms pas 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang yul de la de bzhin du goms pa na mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa yin na goms pas 'jug par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, when one is familiar with that object in that way, it becomes an object of seeing.

original: mthong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Familiarity engages it, but it is not seeing.

original: snga ma bzhin du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, as before, there is no difference between them.

original: brtag bya 'dzin pa las gzhan pa de'i bye brag ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: brtag bya 'dzin pa las gzhan pa de'i bye brag ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin te /
translated: The difference between the object of apprehension and the object of investigation is not a factor of engagement because

original: rnam rtog 'ba' zhig ni goms pa med na rang nyid kho na 'jug pa'i yul rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam rtog 'ba' zhig ni goms pa med na rang nyid kho na 'jug pa'i yul rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: mere conceptuality, if not cultivated, itself is the object of engagement that causes realization.

original: goms pa na ni de'i yul nyid 'dzin par nus pa mthong bar sgro 'dogs pa @71b log pa'i phyir gnyi ga la yang 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: goms pa na ni de'i yul nyid 'dzin par nus pa mthong bar sgro 'dogs pa @71b log pa'i phyir gnyi ga la yang 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nus pa yin gyi /
translated: If it is cultivated, it is seen to be able to apprehend its object, because it is the capacity of conceptuality that engages both.

original: mthong ba'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the capacity of seeing,üîΩbecause even if it is cultivated, it is seen to apprehend only the present, since it does not have the capacity to engage with the past and future, because it is not the object of investigation.

original: brtag bya yul ma yin pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba la sogs med pa'i phyir goms pa na yang da ltar ba tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir mthong ba'i snga ma dang gcig tu ji ltar snang bar byed pa yin ;
analyzed: brtag bya yul ma yin pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba la sogs med pa'i phyir goms pa na yang da ltar ba tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir mthong ba'i snga ma dang gcig tu ji ltar snang bar byed pa yin ;
translated: How could it appear as one with the former object of seeing?

original: goms pa'i yul yin pa las goms bya yang de nyid yin la goms pa ni snga ma'i shes pa de'i yul mthong ba la de nyid mthong zhes bya bar brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: goms pa'i yul yin pa las goms bya yang de nyid yin la goms pa ni snga ma'i shes pa de'i yul mthong ba la de nyid mthong zhes bya bar brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: It is the object of familiarity, it is the object of familiarity, and familiarity is said to see that object of the previous consciousness.

original: gzhan la goms pa las gzhan mthong zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan la goms pa las gzhan mthong zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to say that one sees something else through familiarity with something else.

original: sngar mthong ba log na des mthong bya nyid dam /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba log na des mthong bya nyid dam /
translated: If what was seen before is reversed, then either what is seen is reversed,

original: de'i dus kyi de nyid ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i dus kyi de nyid ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: or that reality at that time is reversed.

original: da ltar ba'i yul ji ltar yin /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i yul ji ltar yin /
translated: How can it be the present object?

original: yang ji ltar ma 'khrul pa ma yin /
analyzed: yang ji ltar ma 'khrul pa ma yin /
translated: And how is it not non-mistaken?

original: dngos po med pa ma yin pa las rtogs pa grub pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa can med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ma yin pa las ni ma 'khrul pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ma yin pa las rtogs pa grub pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa can med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa ma yin pa las ni ma 'khrul pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: The statement because it is established from what is not a non-thing and because there is no fault means that it is not non-mistaken from what is not a non-thing,

original: ma 'khrul pa las kyang de med pa ma yin pa yin pa'i phyir gcig pa la gcig pa yin na /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa las kyang de med pa ma yin pa yin pa'i phyir gcig pa la gcig pa yin na /
translated: and because it is not mistaken, it is not a non-thing. Therefore, if one is the other,

original: da ltar gyi yul mthong ba de'i yul can ji ltar yin /
analyzed: da ltar gyi yul mthong ba de'i yul can ji ltar yin /
translated: how can it be the subject that sees the present object?

original: de la goms pa yin na rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'das pa la sogs pa'i yul nyid mthong ba la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de la goms pa yin na rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'das pa la sogs pa'i yul nyid mthong ba la 'gal ba med do //
translated: If one is accustomed to that, then there is no contradiction in seeing the object itself, such as the past, like the cognition of a yogi.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa ni gzhal bya de la de bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa ni gzhal bya de la de bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa yin la /
translated: The cognition of a yogi apprehends that object of comprehension just as it is.

original: mthong ba yang rnam par rtog pa'i phyir bye brag med do //
analyzed: mthong ba yang rnam par rtog pa'i phyir bye brag med do //
translated: And seeing is also non-conceptual, so there is no difference.

analyzed: de dang 'dra bas de yin no zhe na /

analyzed: rtags 'dzin pa la rtags las byung ba grub pa yin pa dang dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum yang ma yin te /

analyzed: dbang po ni sems pa can ma yin pa'i phyir snga ma dran pa ma yin la sbyor bar byed pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: skyes bu ni thag nye ba la de bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa yin te /

analyzed: sems @72a * //

analyzed: pa can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag las skyes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //

analyzed: dran pa la yang nus ldan zhing //

analyzed: 'brel pa sogs dang ldan pa'ang yin //

original: zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes smos pa'o //

analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma mthong ba'i bag chags las byung ba'i phyir yin no //

analyzed: mthong ba snga ma dang phyi ma'i mthong bya nyid gcig nyid du rtog pa'i phyir skyon med do //

analyzed: gcig pa nyid du mthong ba la ji ltar rtog par byed pa yin /

analyzed: mthong bya ma yin pa yang 'bras bu nyid bzhin du brtag bya yin pa'i phyir mthong bya yin no //

original: des na de dag tsam gyis ni mthong ba'i yul gyi khyad par du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na de dag tsam gyis ni mthong ba'i yul gyi khyad par du 'gyur ba yin gyi /

original: cig shos ni ma yin la /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin la /
translated: Because it is a valid

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la khyad par med pa yin na /
translated: If there is no difference in the conceptualization,

original: goms pa la ni 'bras bu nyid kho na bzhin du mthong ba'i yul yang bye brag ma yin no //
analyzed: goms pa la ni 'bras bu nyid kho na bzhin du mthong ba'i yul yang bye brag ma yin no //

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid ni nye ba'i phyir snang ba yin no zhe na /

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid la yang mtshungs so //

original: 'bras bu nyid ni nye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni nye ba yin no //

analyzed: bye brag ma yin pa yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir bye brag med do //

analyzed: goms pa yin yang mthong bas de 'dzin pa ma yin na /

analyzed: de lta yin na de 'dzin pa ma yin yang rjes su dpag pa bzhin du 'jug par byed pa mi rigs te /

analyzed: mthong ba de 'dzin par byed pa yin te /

analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rjes su @72b brjod pa nyid ma yin te /

original: snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Thinking this,

analyzed: de la nges pa'i ngo bo'i 'bras bu ni gzhan la ltos pa yin gyi /

analyzed: 'di nyid kyi gcig pa nyid ni de bzhin du ma yin te /

analyzed: goms pa las byung ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa ni mthong bar byed pa yin yang ji ltar 'das pa 'dzin pa yin ;
translated: The cognition of a yogi that arises from cultivation is seeing, but how can it grasp the past?

original: de yang nye ba nyid mthong bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang nye ba nyid mthong bar byed pa yin la /

analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa de'i yul nyid yin pa ni 'u bu cag la sogs pa la ltos nas yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de dang gcig pa nyid du shes pa yin na 'jug pa yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de ni grub zin pa'i phyir don du gnyer ba ma yin no //
translated: And since it is already established, it is not something to be sought.

analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba rtogs pa'i don du 'jug pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that you engage in it for the sake of realizing what will arise,

original: de lta yin pa ni bden na /
analyzed: de lta yin pa ni bden na /
translated: that is true.

original: de da ltar ni med pa yin na /
analyzed: de da ltar ni med pa yin na /
translated: But if it does not exist in the present,

original: ji ltar mthong bas 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong bas 'dzin par byed /

analyzed: sngon mthong ba de'i ngo bo ma mthong ba las 'dir rjes su rtogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /

original: mi rigs te /
analyzed: mi rigs te /

analyzed: de'i ngo bo 'dzin pa na de rtogs par ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when you apprehend its nature, you do not see that you realize it.

original: de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba de la yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba de la yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is that which will arise,

original: de de lta yin na /
analyzed: de de lta yin na /
translated: if that is so,

original: goms pa yod pa'i mthong ba'am /
analyzed: goms pa yod pa'i mthong ba'am /
translated: then you see what exists through familiarity.

original: gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa ji ltar 'jug pa'i yul yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa ji ltar 'jug pa'i yul yin /
translated: How can it be the object of engagement of the thought that understands it?

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: It is taught as follows:

original: da ltar ba mthong ba ni sngon mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba mthong ba ni sngon mthong ba ma yin te /

analyzed: the tshom yin pa'i phyir la / gnyis pa la yang goms @73a * //

original: pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: pa med pa yin na /

analyzed: de nyid yin pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'jug par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the thought that it is that very thing would not engage it,

original: thob zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thob zin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: thob pa ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi rnam par rtog pas 'jug pa ma yin te /

analyzed: ji ltar 'jug pa'i yul yin /

analyzed: don byed pa ni gzhan de dang 'dra ba yin la /

analyzed: ma goms pa la rnam par rtog pas de nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i nus pa med pa yin na /
translated: If, due to non-familiarity, one does not apprehend that very [nature] due to conceptualization, then it lacks the ability to engage.

original: goms pa la yang mthong bas nus par sgro btags kyang 'jug par byed pa nyid gal yin /
analyzed: goms pa la yang mthong bas nus par sgro btags kyang 'jug par byed pa nyid gal yin /
translated: Even in familiarity, seeing is merely imputed as having the ability, but it is still necessary to engage.

original: mthong ba ni don byed pa yang de'i tshe mi rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba ni don byed pa yang de'i tshe mi rigs pa yin la /

analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang de rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir de don du gnyer ba po rnams ji ltar 'jig pa yin /

original: de dang 'brel pa can nyid shes pa las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can nyid shes pa las yin no zhe na /
